Coffee Origin: Ruili Village, Meishan Township, Alishan, Chiayi County, Taiwan
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, delicately tart. Dried red plum, cocoa nib, sweet lime, spruce, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of sweet lime and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Buku Abel Bastet Station Geisha Washed Espresso
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly tart, very chocolaty. Chocolate fudge, pomegranate, tangelo, gardenia, maple syrup in aroma and small cup. Syrupy-smooth  mouthfeel; tart-leaning, crisply chocolaty finish. As a cappuccino, this coffee sings with the depth of chocolate, the high-toned sweet-tartness of pomegranate, and the unifying harmony of gardenia and tangelo.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Bastet Washing Station. Caoban Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Taipei. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, gently tart. Pomegranate, baking chocolate, marjoram, goji berry, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet, gentle acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly tart finish with undertones of goji berry and marjoram.
Notes: Produced by Angelina Lopez of Finca Los Papales, entirely of the Red Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Citrus-sweet. Tangerine, cocoa nib, rose hips, myrrh, honey in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of rose hips and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding Huye Mountain Washing Station, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral, deeply fruit-forward. Cherry cordial, dark chocolate, pink peppercorn, aromatic orchid, marjoram in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; vibrant, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Expressive, juicy, long-lasting finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermosa, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary method Noreña calls “carbonic galaxy hops,” in which the whole fruit is fermented with hops and mossto (coffee fruit juice) before being dried. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Toraja growing region, south-central Sulawesi, Indonesia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, rich and deep-toned. Lemon verbena, ginger blossom, hinoki wood, date, vanilla bean in aroma and cup. Gently bright, malic acidity; plush, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Spice-toned, sweet and integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the S795 and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit, skin and pulp removed before drying).  Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Even-keeled, sweetly citrusy. Cocoa nib, pink grapefruit, almond butter, cherry blossom, nougat in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy-sooth mouthfeel.Quietly confident finish with notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Asociación Civil Guaya'b from trees of the Bourbon, Catimor, Caturra, Maragogype and Pache varieties of Arabica.  Processed by the washed method (fruit, skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Cyiya Village, Nyamasheke District, Western Province, Rwanda
Blind Assessment: Delicate, balanced, richly sweet. Bing cherry, bergamot, bay leaf, cocoa nib, poppyseed in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to pretty notes of bergamot and cherry.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed at the Murundo Washing Station by the washed method (fruit, skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Baking chocolate, Graham cracker, almond, citrus saltwater taffy, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of citrus saltwater taffy and oak.
Notes: Ground coffee with 250mg of lion’s mane and cordyceps mushrooms. Heady Cup is an Illinois-based specialty roaster with a focus on sustainability and sourcing traceable green coffees. Visit

Coffee Origin: Kihoya, Mathioya District, Murang’a County, Kenya
Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly savory. Pluot, cocoa nib, plumeria, candycap mushroom, wild honey in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, satiating finish.
Notes: Produced by 727 smallholding farmers and processed at the Gondo Washing Station by the washed method (fruit, skin and pulp removed before drying). Speedwell Coffee, based in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is a wholesale and retail specialty roaster particularly dedicated to offering attractive coffee subscription plans. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, quite sweet. Dark chocolate, dried nectarine, dark caramel, orange zest, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and orange zest.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Volcanica Coffee is a family-owned business in Suwanee, Georgia, whose roots go back two generations to coffee farming in Costa Rica. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Lychee, rose hips, oolong tea, cocoa nib, magnolia in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned, oolong-like finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermosa, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which much of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Finca La Sirena Mango Co-Ferment
Blind Assessment: Richly floral, deeply fruity. Guava, cocoa nib, neroli, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Crisply tart acidity; very satiny, viscous mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Puerta of Finca La Sirena, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method with osmotic dehydration (which involves soaking coffee cherries in a hypertonic glucose solution to create osmotic pressure that gently removes moisture from the fruit) and co-fermented with mango. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, sweetly savory. Raspberry, honey, vanilla yogurt, baking chocolate, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Savory-sweet, bright acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and honey with undertones of hop flowers.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method with the addition of wine yeasts and lychee to the fermentation. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Fruity-sweet, gently spice-toned. Fruit punch, green peppercorn, blackberry leaf, oak, hazelnut in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Green peppercorn and fruit punch notes carry the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by Brayan Alvea, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by co-fermenting the whole cherries with dehydrated coconut and coconut water, then drying them in the whole fruit with lemon peel. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, crisply bright. Pomegranate, myrrh, raw cacao, lemon verbena, freesia in aroma and cup. Citric acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with notes of raw cacao and lemon verbena.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a watermelon co-ferment produced by Edwin Noreña and a honey produced by Juan Campo. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, deeply sweet, gently tart. Star jasmine, tea rose, narcissus, blood orange cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; very syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish that is both sweet and spice-toned.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a washed Colombia, a washed Ethiopia and a thermal-shock anaerobic from Wilton Benitez’s Al Paraiso 92 Cauca farm. Founded in 2013, modcup focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. This special release is available to members of modcup’s Deepcuts list. Visit

Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, citrusy-sweet. Strawberry, lemon verbena, cocoa butter, brown sugar, sassafras in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Strawberry and cocoa notes carry the juicy finish.
Notes: A blend of four coffees: a washed Colombia, a Colombia co-fermented with peaches, a Colombia co-fermented with strawberries and a washed Ethiopia. Founded in 2013, modcup focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. This special release is available to members of modcup’s Deepcuts list. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly fermenty, crisply fruit-forward. Rum barrel, dried raspberry, chocolate syrup, maraschino cherry, salted almond in aroma and cup. Crisp, tart acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweetly fermenty finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: an Ethiopia Guji natural and a Café La Granja, Colombia natural. Founded in 2013, modcup focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. This special release is available to members of modcup’s Deepcuts list. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Kaffa Gimbo Lot Rich Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Expressive, invitingly nuanced, lyrical. Guava, dark chocolate, star jasmine, amber, candied pink grapefruit zest in aroma and small cup. Lively, viscous mouthfeel; balanced, floral, fruity finish. In cappuccino format, voluptuous, rich, deep-toned.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, juicy-bright. Dried strawberry, wild honey, wisteria, pomelo, macadamia nut in aroma and cup. Vibrant, sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Dried strawberry and macadamia notes are supported by wisteria and pomelo in the long, lush finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Rich-toned, floral, complex. Magnolia, dark chocolate, tangerine, black cherry, cedar in aroma and small cup. Smooth, syrupy mouthfeel; long, resonant, flavor-saturated finish. In cappuccino format, chocolaty, fruit-toned and very floral.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a washed Panama Geisha and a washed Ethiopia Geisha.

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, complex, multilayered. Narcissus, mango, cardamom, dark chocolate, honeydew melon in aroma and cup. Juicy, winey acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated finish led by narcissus and cardamom with undertones of dark chocolate and honeydew.
Notes: Produced by members of the GuKeng Farmers Association, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). GuKeng is a new label co-established by the GuKeng Farmers Association of Yunlin County and local coffee farmers. The coffee is roasted by the farmers’ association and is sold at their local farmers' market. Email

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet-tart, fruit-toned and floral. Dried plum, freesia, lemon verbena, tamarind, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright, winey acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of dried plum and freesia.
Notes: Produced by Eulises Guzman of Finca La Lomita, entirely of the Colombia variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Peru Washed Cusco Buena Vista Soola SL09
Blind Assessment: Bright, high-toned, crisply sweet-tart. Passionfruit, pink peppercorn, dark chocolate, kumquat, oregano in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Lingering, flavor-laden finish is complex and multilayered.
Notes: Produced by Valerio Almanza Ccahua of Buena Vista Farm, entirely of the SL-09 variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, nuanced and vibrant. White mulberry, honeysuckle, pistachio, cocoa nib, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pistachio and cocoa nib with undertones of mulberry.
Notes: Produced by members of the GuKeng Farmers Association, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GuKeng is a new label co-established by the GuKeng Farmers Association of Yunlin County and local coffee farmers. The coffee is roasted by the farmers’ association and is sold at their local farmers' market. Email

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Chocolaty, sweetly savory. Dark chocolate, hop flowers, pomegranate, oak, myrrh in aroma and small cup. Delicate, silky mouthfeel; exceptionally aromatic, long, resonant finish. In cappuccino format, dark chocolate and myrrh are supported by tart pomegranate notes.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a natural Panama Geisha, an anaerobic washed Ethiopia Geisha and an anaerobic washed Colombia Geisha.

Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Jolly Rancher, pineapple taffy, marjoram, amber, honey in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Crisp finish is carried by notes of pineapple taffy and marjoram.
Notes: Produced by members of the GuKeng Farmers Association, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). GuKeng is a new label co-established by the GuKeng Farmers Association of Yunlin County and local coffee farmers. The coffee is roasted by the farmers’ association and is sold at their local farmers' market. Email

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply fruity, spice-toned. Warming spices, jasmine, dark chocolate, cedar, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; richly wood-framed, fruit-forward finish. In three parts milk, spice-toned florals and baking spices carry the cup.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a washed Colombia Geisha and an anaerobic Ethiopia Geisha.

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, floral-toned. Magnolia, cantaloupe, tangelo, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, very satiny mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of magnolia and tangelo.
Notes: Produced by members of the GuKeng Farmers Association, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GuKeng is a new label co-established by the GuKeng Farmers Association of Yunlin County and local coffee farmers. The coffee is roasted by the farmers’ association and is sold at their local farmers' market. Email

Blind Assessment: Bright, crisply sweet-tart. Pluot, baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, sandalwood, wisteria in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, vibrant acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of pluot and baking chocolate with pink grapefruit undertones.
Notes: Produced by members of the GuKeng Farmers Association, entirely of the SL34 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GuKeng is a new label co-established by the GuKeng Farmers Association of Yunlin County and local coffee farmers. The coffee is roasted by the farmers’ association and is sold at their local farmers' market. Email

Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Watermelon candy, almond brittle, lemon verbena, violet, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; vibrant, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Notes of almond brittle and violet carry the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, gently tart. Tamarind, dried coconut, baking chocolate, marjoram, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet, gentle acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly tart finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Fruity, chocolaty-sweet. Chocolate fudge, mango, fresh-cut fir, cashew, spearmint in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; gently drying, chocolaty finish with fir undertones. In cappuccino format, mango and spearmint notes resurface to complicate the chocolate throughline.
Notes: Produced by Luis Mauricio Riviera, from trees of the Caturra and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Roasted in Naples, Italy, by Saka Caffé and distributed in the U.S. by Torrefare. Visit

Coffee Origin: Caicendonia, Valle Del Cauca, Cauca Department, Colombia
Blind Assessment: Delicate, resonant, juicy-bright. Lychee, marjoram, lemon verbena, pink peppercorn, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; lightly syrupy, engaging mouthfeel. Bold, richly aromatic finish that carries over all the flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Cafe Granja La Esperanza’s Las Margaritas Farm, entirely of the Sudan Rume variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Elegant, gently fruit-driven. Wild raspberry, bay leaf, narcissus, amber, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Lively, balanced acidity; lushly satiny mouthfeel. Resonant, integrated, harmonious finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, juicy, high-toned. Bing cherry, pomelo, almond brittle, graphite, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Sparkling, very vibrant acidity; lithe, energetic, satiny smooth mouthfeel. Pomelo and almond brittle notes carry the finish, with undertones of lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmer-members of AMCOS (Agricultural Marketing Co-operative Society), from trees of the Blue Mountain, Bourbon, Kilimanjaro and Luwiro varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Itumpi Washing Station. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Gotiti Angel Station Geisha Washed
Coffee Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Complex, richly aromatic. Bergamot, cocoa nib, pink peppercorn, narcissus, redwood in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Long, resonant, satiating finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Buku Abel Bastet Geisha Washed
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Delicately bright, balanced, multi-layered. Apricot, Meyer lemon, wisteria, cocoa nib, rosemary in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet, malic acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned, sweetly herbaceous finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, brightly tart. Red grape, coriander, tangelo, brown sugar, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright, malic acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of red grape, coriander and brown sugar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers around the Murundo Washing Station, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, deeply sweet. Dark chocolate, agave syrup, cashew butter, sweet lime, gardenia in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty, delicately floral finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Lemon tart, ripe tomato, alyssum, cocoa nib, blackberry taffy in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning, citrusy acidity; plush very satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of blackberry taffy and alyssum.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Tangy, vibrant, sweetly tart. Tamarind, dark chocolate, lilac, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, tangy finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: San José de Minas, Pichincha Province, Ecuador
Blind Assessment: Juicy-bright, richly sweet. Wisteria, pomegranate, raspberry, pineapple saltwater taffy, raw cacao in aroma and cup. Balanced, energetic acidity;
Notes: Produced by Maria Alexandra Rivera and Galo Morales and their extended family at Finca Cruz Loma, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, sweetly tart. Guava, young ginger, maraschino cherry, chocolate syrup, lemon-thyme in aroma and cup. Juicy, sparkling acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Very long, flavor-saturated, tropical-leaning finish.
Notes: P

Blind Assessment: Enigmatic, nuanced. Narcissus, bergamot, cocoa nib, dried peach, wild honey in aroma and cup. Richly sweet structure with bright, balanced acidity; plush, syrupy  mouthfeel. Long, rich, floral-toned finish with undertones of cocoa nib and dried peach.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently fruit-toned, crisply chocolaty. Kiwi, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, nougat, myrrh in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Harmonious, resonant, rich-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by the Vinhal Family of Vinhal Cafes Artesanais, entirely of the Red Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by an experimental co-fermentation method with grape starfruit. Rainforest Alliance-certified. Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply fruit-toned, richly chocolaty. Lychee, date, dark chocolate, almond butter, tangelo in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, crisply nutty finish with undertones of lychee.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Duwancho Cooperative, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Tart-leaning, crisply cocoa-toned. Pomegranate, tamarind, baking chocolate, rhododendron, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of brown sugar and tamarind.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the AMCOS Cooperative, from trees of the Blue Mountain, Bourbon, Kilimanjaro and LuwiroIntuition varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Finca Santa Barbara Gesha Anaerobic Honey
Blind Assessment: Elegant, nuanced, gently bright. Red plum, hazelnut nougat, plumeria, cocoa nib, mesquite in aroma and cup. Delicately malic (apple-like) acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Long, lingering, resonantly sweet, floral finish.
Notes: Produced by Jhon Samboni of Finca Santa Barbara, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is removed from the beans, then fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying. Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Pomelo & Taiwanese No. 12 Tea Flavor
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, uniquely composed. Grape candy, lime zest, lemon verbena, oak forest, wild honey in aroma and cup. Balanced, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Sweet-toned, quietly citrusy finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a Colombia fermented with pomelo and a Taiwan fermented with tea. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy, sweetly tart. Pomegranate, freesia, pink peppercorn, cocoa nib, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Resonant finish leads with notes of cocoa nib and pink peppercorn.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a washed Ethiopia, a natural Ethiopia and a Colombia winey natural.  Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, richly sweet. Baking chocolate, date, tangelo, hazelnut cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned finish.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia and South America. Mystic Monk Coffee is a small-batch roaster associated with a Carmelite monastery located in the Rocky Mountains of northern Wyoming. The monks emphasize an artisan approach to roasting and a commitment to quality. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned, gently smoky. Hazelnut, baking chocolate, scorched fir, toffee, green apple in aroma and small cup. Very full, syrupy mouthfeel; quiet, sweetly wood-framed, smoky finish. In cappuccino format, balanced, crisply chocolaty and deeply sweet.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Brazil and Colombia, roasted for espresso applications. North Koffee Artisan Roasters, based in Kingstown, Rhode Island, specializes in roasting coffees from a wide range of origins across all roast levels. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Faver Emir Ninco Pink Bourbon
Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, cocoa-toned. Tamarind, cocoa nib, pomegranate, narcissus, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Tamarind and cocoa nib lead in the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by Emir Ninco of Finca Costa Rica, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Elegantly aromatic, high-toned. Bergamot, cocoa nib, apricot, pink grapefruit zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sparkling acidity; silky mouthfeel. Very long, harmonious finish, delicately rich, deeply aromatic.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, balanced, floral-toned. Star jasmine, guava nectar, almond nougat, bay leaf, blood orange in aroma and cup. Vibrant, sparkling acidity; very silky, lively mouthfeel. Notes of star jasmine and cocoa nib commingle in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Consuelo Marín and Javier Macias of Finca Lusitania, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit  skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, gently earthy. Pipe tobacco, baking chocolate, goji berry, pralines, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with brisk acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Pipe tobacco and baking chocolate notes carry the finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the traditional Indonesian washed and wet-hulled method. Satur Specialty Coffee is a farm-to-cup roastery, coffee shop, and SCA training center. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, deep-toned. Dark chocolate, date, lilac, pink peppercorn, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, floral-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by 13 smallholding farmers, from trees of the

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, crisply chocolaty. Raspberry jam, baking chocolate, sassafras, almond butter, freesia in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity, very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Berry-toned finish supported by notes of baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Certified USDA Organic. Bongo Java Roasting Co., based in Nashville, Tennessee, buys organically grown coffee directly from small-scale farmer groups at prices above the fair trade level. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Ripe tomato, red currant, candied walnut, cedar, narcissus in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-saturated, very long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the SL28, SL34, Ruiru 11 and Batian varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method at the Kii Factory. Dou Zhai Coffee & Roastery is a Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster and cafe. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Brunca Rivense La Guaca Passion Honey
Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty and fruit-forward. Dark chocolate, finger lime, lychee, almond, freesia in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with citric acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of Dark chocolate and lychee.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Rivense, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (coffee fruit is pulped or skinned but dried in the fruit flesh). Dou Zhai Coffee & Roastery is a Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster and cafe. Visit

Coffee Origin: Kaʻū growing region, Hawai’i Island, Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Lushly sweet, rich-toned, balanced. Cocoa nib, gardenia, honeydew melon, sandalwood, allspice in aroma and cup. Juicy, sparkling acidity; vibrant, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, perfumed, engaging and very long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Typica, Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Island Coffee Roasters is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Coffee Origin: Kaʻū growing region, Hawai’i Island, Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Richly floral, high-toned. Wisteria, dried peach, cocoa nib, tangerine, oak forest in aroma and cup. Delicately tart acidity; plush, silky mouthfeel. A resiny myrrh-like note emerges in the flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced at Elepoki Farm, entirely of the Yellow Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Island Coffee Roasters is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicate, tropical, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, passion fruit, bergamot, amber, wild honey in aroma and cup. Juicy, malic acidity; smooth, very satiny mouthfeel. The finish fulfills the promise of the cup with rich aromatics that linger.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lasso and Nikolai Furst of Finca El Rubi, entirely of Ethiopia landrace varieties of Arabica they germinated in Colombia. Processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Jaunt Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based roaster and café with an extensive coffee and food menu. Visit

Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet, richly tart, deep-toned. Bing cherry, lemongrass, pomelo, agave syrup, frankincense in aroma and cup. High-toned, juicy acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated, complex finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Kungahara Women’s Group (Bwishaza), entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the carbonic maceration method, which involves fermenting the whole fruit in a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2, then drying in the whole fruit. Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Intricate, richly sweet-savory. Apple cider, salted caramel, basil, freesia, graphite in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Complex, lingering, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Hacienda La Papaya, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Xam Tai district, Houaphan province, Laos
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet, gently herbaceous. Cocoa nib, agave syrup, pansy, cedar, grapefruit in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Rich cedar notes support cocoa nib and grapefruit in the finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Java and Catimor varieties of Arabica, and processed by the low-oxygen honey method, in which the beans are fermented in a low-oxygen environment with some of their muciilage still attached throughout the dying process. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, deep-toned. Dark chocolate, praline, narcissus, tangerine, olive oil in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Citrus and olive-like herbaceousness support a chocolaty finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca Churupampa, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, crisply cocoa-toned. Date, cocoa powder, Meyer lemon zest, agave syrup, oak in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by Meyer lemon zest and oak.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Decaffeinated in Colombia using ethyl acetate, a solvent derived from sugar cane. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly spice-toned, gently floral. Bergamot, hop flowers, guava, oak forest, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. High-toned, sweetly citric acidity; vibrant, very silky mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated, confidently aromatic, inviting and long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Bursa Village, Arbegona, Sidama growing region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, berry-toned. Mulberry, tamarind, mustard seed, candied violet, lemongrass in aroma and cup. Crisp, briskly sweet acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Berry-laden finish propped up by notes of tangy tamarind and richly savory-spicy mustard seed.
Notes: Produced by Mullugeta Muntasha, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ka’u growing region, Hawai’i Island, Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Very rich, very sweet, complex and multilayered. Amber, dried nectarine, almond butter, graphite, wisteria in aroma and cup. Balanced, malic (apple-like) acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Lingering finish consolidates to notes of nectarine and amber.
Notes: Produced in Ka’u from trees of the big-beaned Maragogipe (also spelled Maragogype), Pacamara, and Maracaturra varieties of Arabica and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Big Island Coffee Roasters is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ka’u growing region, Hawai’i Island, Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet, nuanced and complex. Dark chocolate, candied violet, salted caramel, sandalwood, jasmine in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sparkling acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Resonant, integrated, satisfying finish.
Notes: Produced in Ka’u from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Island Coffee Roasters is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply sweet. Dark chocolate, toffee, narcissus, Bing cherry, mesquite in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Exceptionally long finish that carries over all the flavor and aroma notes from the cup.
Notes: A blend of coffees from the Kona District on Hawai’i Island, processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Island Coffee Roasters is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Coffee Name: Guatemala Retiro del Quisaya Washed Process
Coffee Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply sweet, complex. Black cherry, nutmeg, dark chocolate, amber narcissus in aroma and cup. Bright, malic acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and nutmeg.
Notes: Produced by Juan Luis Barrios Ortega of Finca Retiro del Quisaya from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (skin and fruit pulp removed before washing). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, berry-toned, very rich and deep. Chocolate fudge, salted caramel, dried strawberry, freesia, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Richly chocolaty, long-lingering, berry-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Mortem Labs is a Norfolk, Virginia roastery that offers small-batch blends and select single-origin coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, nuanced and aromatic. Candy apple, almond nougat, hop flowers, frankincense, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Even-keeled acidity; mouth-filling, viscous body. Richly bittersweet finish with notes of candy apple and hops.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate, from trees of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, with the addition of mossto (fresh-pressed coffee fruit juice) to the fermentation. Hifalutin Coffee Roasters is a Charleston, South Carolina-based specialty coffee roaster with two cafes in town. Visit

Blind Assessment: Quietly confident, fruity and cocoa-toned. Orange creamsicle, cocoa nib, candied violet, hazelnut, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with sweet herb and citrus undertones.
Notes: Produced by Sebastian Ramirez of Fincas El Placer, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the white honey method, in which a small amount of fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Sun Bear Specialty Coffee Roasters’ motto is “Fruit Forward, Farmer Forward, Process Forward, Passion Forward” — based in St. Petersburg, Florida. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Finca Al Paraiso Y–05 Lychee
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, fruit-driven. Rambutan, candied violet, ginger blossom, bittersweet chocolate syrup, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy-tart acidity; very full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Complex, multi-layered, exceptionally long finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over-oxidation or continued fermentation. Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, balanced, juicy-sweet. Cocoa nib, strawberry guava, cashew butter, pink peppercorn, lemongrass in aroma and cup. High-toned, malic acidity; very smooth, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with notes of lemongrass and pink peppercorn.
Notes: Sourced from Coffee Quest in Medellin, Colombia; produced by smallholding farmers and comprised of “las perlitas” (little pearls) of green coffees that are a blend of high-end varieties from lots that are too small, as well as salvaged high-end green coffees that were re-sorted and salvaged from the defect piles. Processed by the anaerobic honey method, in which in some of the fruit flesh is removed from the beans, then fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying. Iconik Coffee Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster in Santa Fe, New Mexico with three cafes. Visit

Coffee Name: Panama Altieri Luci Geisha Natural Cold Dry Ferment
Blind Assessment: Complex, deep-toned, richly sweet. Juicy Fruit gum, tangerine, chocolate fudge, narcissus, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity, plush syrupy mouthfeel. Multilayered finish goes on and on.
Notes: Produced by Eugene Altieri of Finca Alto Quiel/Mima Estates, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural cold-dry fermentation process, in which the whole fruit is slow-fermented at 10-13 degrees Celsius for 72 hours, then dried in the whole fruit. Klatch Coffee is an award-winning small-batch roasting company in the Los Angeles area whose resident barista and trainer, Heather Perry, won both the 2003 and 2007 United States Barista Championships brewing a Klatch Coffee espresso blend. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, deeply sweet. Wisteria, hazelnut, dark chocolate, date bar, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sparkling (phosphoric) acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Crisp chocolate and sweet florals carry the pleasing finish.
Notes: Produced at Hacienda La Minita, from trees of the Caturra, Typica and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). DoubleShot Coffee Company is a specialty roaster in Tulsa, Oklahoma founded by author Brian Franklon, who’s always in search of the perfect cup. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, classic Kenya profile. Cocoa nib, pink grapefruit zest, tomato vine, blackcurrant, redwood in aroma and cup.Sparkling acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of Cocoa nib and tomato vine.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Cutbow Coffee, based in Albuquereque, New Mexico, is a specialty coffee roaster owned and operated by master roaster Paul Gallegos. Visit

Coffee Origin: Marcala growing region, La Paz Department, Honduras
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deep-toned. Nutella, mandarin, red plum, marjoram, cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, balanced acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Aftertaste is quite aromatic, leads with notes of cedar and Nutella.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the RAOS Cooperative from trees of the Bourbon, Catuai, Caturra, Lempira, Ihcafe 90 and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Imported by Royal Coffee. Handlebar Coffee was founded in Santa Barbara in 2011 by two former professional cyclists, and the couple now operate two coffee shops, as well. Visit

Coffee Origin: Perez Zeldon, Brunca growing region, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet, crisply tart. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, yellow plum, honey, oak in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy-sweet acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Closes with notes of cocoa nib and yellow plum with fresh oak undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the CoopiAgri Cooperative, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Imported by Algrano. Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, deep-toned, earthy. Petrichor, molasses, almond butter, candy apple, cedar in aroma and cup. Soft, round acidity; plush, fluffy-satiny mouthfeel. Sweet tobacco finish with cedary undertones lifted by hints of candy apple.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Indonesia and Central and South America. Red Rock Roasters was founded in Albuquerque, New Mexico in 1993 in a family barn and remains family-owned and focused on quality and freshness. Visit

Blind Assessment: Reviewed for brewed applications. Chocolaty, gently bright. Date, milk chocolate, crisp pear, sassafras, hint of gardenia. Round, gentle acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweetly herbaceous finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees, a washed Colombia and a natural-processed El Salvador. Ragamuffin Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Newbury Park, California. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Baking chocolate, date, cashew, fresh-cut fir, orange zest in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Crisp finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and fir.
Notes: A blend of undisclosed origins. Single Speed Coffee Lab & Roastery, based in Flagstaff, Arizona, is a family-owned and -operated roastery and cafe. Visit

Coffee Origin: Chelchele, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly citrusy, cocoa-toned, delicately aromatic. Cocoa nib, Meyer lemon, freesia, almond butter, apricot in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Citrusy-sweet finish with undertones of cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by the METAD farm and mill in southern Ethiopia. Southern Ethiopia produces distinctive coffees from selections of traditional landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Slow Burn Coffee Roasters, based in Albuquerque, New Mexico, specializes in single-origin coffee and roasts in small batches. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Guji Grape GildVine Natural G1
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Rich, fruity, deeply chocolaty. Wild blueberry, milk chocolate, gardenia, pink peppercorn, oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Milk chocolate and blueberry commingle in the complex, nuanced finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet-savory. Dark chocolate, boysenberry, almond brittle, sorrel, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; vibrant, syrupy mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, long-lasting finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Baragwi Farmers Cooperative Society, from trees of the SL34, SL28, Batian and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bear Lake Coffee Co., a B Corp-certified coffeehouse and roastery located in Barronett, Wisconsin, is committed to sustainability through its Coffee with a Purpose™ initiative, which ensures that farmers receive compensation well above the Fairtrade Premium for their exceptional small-batch coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly fruity, crisply chocolaty. Dried blueberry, baking chocolate, salted caramel, fresh-cut oak, thyme in aroma and cup. Crisp, gentle acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of dried blueberry.
Notes: Produced by Gasharu Coffee and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Bear Lake Coffee Co., a B Corp-certified coffeehouse and roastery located in Barronett, Wisconsin, is committed to sustainability through its Coffee with a Purpose™ initiative, which ensures that farmers receive compensation well above the Fairtrade Premium for their exceptional small-batch coffee. Visit

Coffee Origin: Trujillo, Valle Del Cauca, Cauca Department, Colombia
Blind Assessment: Complex, juicy, sweetly tart. Guava, lemongrass, salted caramel, myrrh, galangal in aroma and cup. Delicately high-toned, floral acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Very long, confident, coherent finish.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Cafe Granja La Esperanza, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, deeply floral. Narcissus, blood orange, clove, Concord grape, makrut lime leaf in aroma and cup.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Sudan Rume variety of Arabica, and processed by the thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over-oxidation or continued fermentation. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, vibrantly sweet-savory. Gooseberry, rhododendron, dark chocolate, amber, cedar in aroma and cup. Complex, juicy acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-saturated, very long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gikanda Farmers' Cooperative Society, from trees of the SL28, SL34 and Batian varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Kangocho Factory. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Origin: Trujillo, Valle Del Cauca, Cauca Department, Colombia
Blind Assessment: Sangria. Red Grape. Guava. Red Apple. Richly sweet, crisply sweet-tart. Raspberry, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, wisteria, hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Balanced, malic acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Tart-leaning, cocoa-toned, multilayered finish.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Cafe Granja La Esperanza, entirely of the Mandela variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, sweetly fruity. Dark chocolate, blackberry, salted caramel, rhododendron, tangerine in aroma and cup. Balanced, mild acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Exceptionally long, chocolaty and fruit-forward finish.
Notes: Produced by Alva Flores, entirely of the Marsellesa-Criollo variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, juicy-bright. Pomegranate, agave syrup, roasted almond, butter cookie, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly-tart acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Tart-leaning finish supported by notes of agave syrup and butter cookie.
Notes: Produced by Olegario Herrera Carrada of Finca La Cienega, from trees of the Marsellesa and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Pugchen Mumuntic, San Juan Chamula, Chiapas, Mexico
Blind Assessment: Vibrantly sweet-savory. Lychee, baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, freesia, amber in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and freesia.
Notes: Produced by Juan Carlos Lopez, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, rich-toned. Dark chocolate, date, lilac, cedar, pomelo in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-toned structure with mild acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of date and cedar.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Indonesia (Sumatra), Kenya and Colombia designed to celebrate Equator’s 30th anniversary. Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Blue Donkey Lot 2
Blind Assessment: Gently fruit-forward, complex, high-toned. Passionfruit, amber, wisteria, cocoa nib, tangerine in aroma and cup. Bright, sparkling acidity; silky-smooth, vibrant mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated, harmonious, very long finish.
Notes: Guji is a coffee-growing region nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidama regions. Guji coffees are largely produced from distinctive landrace varieties of Arabica long grown there. Processed by the natural method (beans are dried in the whole fruit).  Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Trust the Process Costa Rica Finca Carrizal SL28 Black Diamond Natural
Coffee Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, elegantly tart, complex. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, strawberry guava, lemongrass, palo santo in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright, balanced acidity; plush, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Long, multilayered, resonant finish that carries all the aroma and flavor notes of the cup into the long.
Notes: Produced by Oscar and Francisca Chacon, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Guatemala Washed Finca El General Gesha
Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, deeply floral. Dark chocolate, narcissus, apricot, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Balanced, malic acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of narcissus and almond.
Notes: Produced at Finca El General, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Guatemala Finca El General Bourbon Honey Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deep-toned, sweetly tart. Black cherry, dark chocolate, marjoram, pink grapefruit, hazelnut in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; chocolaty, tart-leaning finish. In cappuccino format, richly sweet, brightly tart, deeply chocolaty.
Notes: Produced at Finca El General, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply sweet, richly savory. Pomegranate, freesia, cocoa powder, lemongrass, honey in aroma and small cup. Satiny-smooth mouthfeel; cocoa-toned, citrusy finish. In cappuccino format, cocoa-driven with undertones of pomegranate and honey.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia and Guatemala, roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly aromatic, sweetly tart. Lychee, pomelo, dark chocolate, cedar, apple blossom in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; fruit-toned, chocolaty finish. As cappuccino, dark chocolate, apple blossom and lychee play nicely with milk.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Guatemala, Ethiopia and Colombia, roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Sebastian Ramirez Washed Pink Bourbon
Blind Assessment: High-toned, lushly floral. Red currant, cocoa nib, wisteria, myrrh, pomelo in aroma and cup. Sparkling, balanced, very juicy acidity; taut, satiny mouthfeel. Long, harmonious, integrated and flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by Sebastian Ramirez, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Heady Cup is an Illinois-based specialty roaster with a focus on sustainability and sourcing traceable green coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly berry-toned, gently fermenty. Raspberry coulis, wine barrel, dark chocolate, clove, gardenia in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish revolves around notes of raspberry and wine barrel.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding the Manos Juntas Micromill, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso produced as a “ristretto” 25ml (.85-ounce) shot using a Nespresso capsule espresso brewer with whole milk heated using a conventional steam wand. Briskly sweet, gently wood-framed. Baking chocolate, almond, fir, golden raisin, marjoram in aroma and small cup. Light-bodied mouthfeel; sweet-toned, wood-framed finish with undertones of baking chocolate. In cappuccino format, chocolate notes are amplified, and marjoram resurfaces.
Notes: Roasted in Northern Italy and distributed in North America. Marcelo Bomrad-Casanova launched Caffè Bomrad with a commitment to the most authentic tradition of Italian coffee roasting practices. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Briskly sweet-tart, crisply chocolaty. Date, roasted almond, baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, fresh-cut oak in aroma and small cup. Lightly satiny mouthfeel; tart, wood-framed finish with sweet citrus undertones. In three parts milk, balanced and richly bittersweet, with nice baking chocolate and almond notes in the foreground.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Peru, Ethiopia and Indonesia, roasted for espresso applications. Certified USDA Organic and Fair Trade. Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet, ketoney. Tequila barrel, vanilla, fir pulp, simple syrup, green peppercorn in aroma and cup. Brash acidity; chalky mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with distinct ketone notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra, Catuai and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method. The green coffee was rested in whiskey barrels by DF Spices. DF (Deep Flow) Spices is a Canadian specialty spice purveyor with a line of coffee products. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, sweetly citrusy. Wisteria, magrut lime leaf, cocoa butter, pink grapefruit, graphite in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright, balanced acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, harmonious, integrated, satisfying finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Finca La Papaya, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (sun-dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Al Obrah, Hayma Dakhaliya, Sana'a, Yemen
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deeply spice-toned. Red currant, sandalwood, star jasmine, dark chocolate, hint of ginger in aroma and cup. Balanced, gently bright acidity; very full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Red currant and sandalwood notes harmonize in the finish, with undertones of star jasmine, dark chocolate and ginger.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Yemenia variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (sun-dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, deeply savory. Ripe tomato, narcissus, cedar, red currant, almond butter in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Lin Jen-Wei’s Black Jar Coffee, a Taiwan-based nano-roaster and café, is named for both the Taiwanese slang phrase “black soy sauce in black jar,” indicating something is difficult to see through, and the literal black jar in which this company stores coffee to protect it from UV light. Roasted by Lin Jen-Wei, the daughter of the owner, who has been roasting for five years (since she was 13!). For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately fruity, deeply sweet. Dried mulberry, almond nougat, freesia, amber, pink grapefruit in aroma and cup. Brisk, winy acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Exceptionally long, fruit-forward, richly floral finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Ismaili variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Lin Jen-Wei’s Black Jar Coffee, a Taiwan-based nano-roaster and café, is named for both the Taiwanese slang phrase “black soy sauce in black jar,” indicating something is difficult to see through, and the literal black jar in which this company stores coffee to protect it from UV light. Roasted by Lin Jen-Wei, the daughter of the owner, who has been roasting for five years (since she was 13!). For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, sweetly tart. Magnolia, vanilla bean, pistachio, cocoa nib, agave syrup in aroma and cup. High-toned, balanced acidity; crisp, very satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and magnolia.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Lin Jen-Wei’s Black Jar Coffee, a Taiwan-based nano-roaster and café, is named for both the Taiwanese slang phrase “black soy sauce in black jar,” indicating something is difficult to see through, and the literal black jar in which this company stores coffee to protect it from UV light. Roasted by Lin Jen-Wei, the daughter of the owner, who has been roasting for five years (since she was 13!). For more information, visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Geisha Anaerobic Natural
Blind Assessment: Perfumy, sweetly tart, rich-toned. Loquat, cocoa butter, magnolia, neroli, sugarcane in aroma and cup. Crisp, citrusy acidity; very syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Sweet, long, fruit-forward finish.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). Da-Dai Coffee is a small roasting studio in Kaohsiung, Taiwan that specializes in select microlots. Visit

Blind Assessment: Floral, citrusy, sweetly herbaceous. Ginger blossom, tangerine, lemon verbena, coca nib, amber in aroma and cup. Bright, phosphoric acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, flavor-laden, very long finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Yellow Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over-oxidation or continued fermentation. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Origin: Kona growing region, Hawai’i Island, Hawai'i
Blind Assessment: Tropical, richly aromatic, sweetly tart. Guava, pineapple, passionfruit, cocoa nib, Thai basil in aroma and cup. Balanced, juicy-bright acidity; very viscous, silky mouthfeel. Resonant, satisfying, especially long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Typica, Geisha and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method using species of lactic acid-producing yeast and bacteria during the fermentation step. Paradise Roasters specializes in micro-lot Arabica and Robusta coffees from Asia and other emerging origins. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty-sweet, fruit-forward. Baking chocolate, red grape, pink peppercorn, freesia, oak in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of pink peppercorn.
Notes: Produced by the Guerrero, Sepulveda and Trejos families, from trees of the Castillo, Caturra and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, richly savory. Salted caramel, pomegranate, myrrh, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Balanced, briskly sweet acidity; very ful, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and pomegranate with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers around the Murundo Washing Station, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, crisply chocolaty. Honeysuckle, baking chocolate, sugarcane, apricot, almond butter in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish supported by notes of almond and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Pluma, Typica, Bourbon and Mundo Novo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, fruit-forward. Black cherry, chocolate fudge, hazelnut, gardenia, whiskey barrel in aroma and cup. Gently bright, malic acidity; plush, syrupy, vibrant mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of hazelnut and whiskey barrel.
Notes: Produced and roasted by the Meza family at Finca Tasta, a 56-acre farm in Peru that has 19 acres cultivated with coffee and 22 acres of forest preserve. This coffee consists entirely of the Maragogype variety of Arabica and is processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit), then aged in whiskey barrels. International shipping available. Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply sweet-savory. Red currant, ripe tomato, dark chocolate, magnolia, tangerine in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, harmonious, long, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the SL28, SL34, Ruiru 11 and Batian varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method at the Kii Factory. Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet, complex, deep-toned. Cocoa nib, red apple, walnut butter, candied violet, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Very long, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers under the direction of Juan Ramon, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the low-oxygen honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process, which was conducted under low-oxygen conditions. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently fruit-toned, sweetly herbaceous. Pineapple, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, narcissus, honey in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of lemon verbena and narcissus.
Notes: Produced by the Sanchez Family of La Candelilla Estate, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, berry-driven. Dark chocolate, mulberry, agave syrup, tangerine, amber in aroma and cup. Gently brisk acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of mulberry.
Notes: Produced by Arbey Narvaez of Finca El Limon, entirely of the Colombia variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Victrola Coffee Roasters, founded in Seattle in 2000 and named after the popular home phonograph of the 1920s, has seven cafes (one that includes a roastery) throughout the city. Visit

Coffee Name: Guatemala Santa Ana Dilla Alghe Washed
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deep-toned. Caramel apple, baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly syruoy, vibrant mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and almond with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by Nando Diaz of Finca Santa Rosa, entirely of the Dilla Alghe variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Roasted at PT’s Coffee, where the motto is “Without the love, it’s just coffee.” Visit

Coffee Origin: Agaro Duromina, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
