Blind Assessment: Very sweet, cocoa-toned. Almond nougat, dried strawberry, cocoa nib, pink grapefruit, magnolia in aroma and cup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Ateng, Bor Bor, Catimor and Timor varieties of Arabica, and processed at Iwannitosa Putra’s Putra Gayo mill by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Name: El Salvador Finca Plan del Hoyo Microlot
Coffee Origin: Llamatepec, Apaneca growing region, El Salvador
Blind Assessment: Complex, richly aromatic. Dark chocolate, black cherry, almond butter, lavender, raw honey in aroma and cup. Bright, malic (apple-like) acidity; very smooth, satiny mouthfeel. Resonant, chocolaty finish with undertones of black cherry and lavender.
Notes: Produced by Francisco De Sola of Finca Plan del Hoya, from trees of the SL28, Anacafe 14, Pacamara, Pacas and Gesha varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, balanced, juicy. Meyer lemon, red currant, cocoa nib, thyme, freesia in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Very long, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Batian, SL28, SL34 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisp, bittersweet, gently smoky. Cocoa powder, lily, Brazil nut, brown sugar, scorched fir in aroma and cup. No perceptible acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Gently smoky, cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Founded in 1997, Vista Clara Coffee is a Washington-based specialty roaster that offers both retail and wholesale products. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, roast-rounded. Golden raisin, gently scorched fir, molasses, gardenia, orange zest in aroma and cup. Soft, muted acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Gently dring finish centered around notes of molasses and gently scorched fir.
Notes: Produced at Santa Elena Farm and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1997, Vista Clara Coffee is a Washington-based specialty roaster that offers both retail and wholesale products. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama Alice Orchard Natural G1
Blind Assessment: Elegantly fruit-forward, high-toned. Raspberry, guava, dark chocolate, pink grapefruit, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Bright, malic acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweet-tart finish with undertones of sweet citrus notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy-bright, sweetly savory. Red currant, sticky rice, cocoa nib, myrrh, tangerine in aroma and cup. High-toned, sparkling (phosphoric) acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Notes of cocoa nib and red currant lead in the solid finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gachatha Farmers’ Cooperative Society from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet. Halvah, grape candy, freesia, tangerine zest, clove in aroma and cup. Complex, richly layered structure with sweet-tart acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Very sweet, spiced-toned and floral finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers within the San Agustin Management Hub, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Coffee Bros. is a New York-based “full-spectrum” coffee roaster focused on becoming a carbon-neutral operation. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deep-toned. Cocoa nib, star jasmine, black currant, cane sugar, ripe tomato in aroma and cup. Umami-like acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, umami-driven finish with floral undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gachatha Farmers’ Cooperative Society from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Station Geisha Washed
Blind Assessment: Balanced, brightly sweet-tart. Pluot, narcissus, pink grapefruit zest, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant finish that leads with notes of pluot and almond.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Lalisa Black Honey TOH#2
Blind Assessment: Richly fruity, spice-toned. Dried lychee, ginger blossom, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, thyme in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with lively acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp, inviting finish centers around lychee, ginger and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which most of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Tolima Villa Karina Bourbon Naranja Honey
Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet-savory. Yellow plum, almond, pink peppercorn, narcissus, cedar in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Yellow plum and pink peppercorn notes carry the delicate finish.
Notes: Produced by José Amir Garzon of Villa Karina, entirely of the Orange Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, flavor-saturated. Concord grape, tangerine, baking chocolate, amber, freesia in aroma and cup. Juicy, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Citrusy, chocolaty finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, delicately fruit-toned. Dried nectarine, pomelo, pink peppercorn, cocoa nib, sticky rice in aroma and cup. Gently brisk acidity; very silky, vibrant mouthfeel. Cocoa nib and dried nectarine carry the easygoing finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Blind Assessment: Crisply fruit-centered. Cocoa powder, raspberry, lime zest, caramel, cedar in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with caramel and cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers for Asefa and Mulugeta Dukamo of Daye Bensa Exports, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Coffee Bros. is a New York-based “full-spectrum” coffee roaster focused on becoming a carbon-neutral operation. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently fruity, cocoa-toned. Tiramisu, lemon verbena, freesia, fresh-cut oak, orange zest in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity, very full, creamy mouthfeel. Citrusy, cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers near the Koke Washing Station, operated by Semira Negash, entirely of the Kumie Diga Wilsho variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Tart, chocolaty. Baking chocolate, pomegranate, fresh-cut fir, caramel, cashew butter in aroma and small cup. Plush, syrupy mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty and nutty finish. In cappuccino format, fruit and caramel commingle with chocolate and cashew.
Notes: A blend of coffees from undisclosed South and Central America and Africa origins. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Nano GIGANTE 4FC-N Geisha Washed
Blind Assessment: Elegant, plush, floral and multi-layered. Perfectly ripe peach, almond butter, gardenia, Meyer lemon zest, wild honey in aroma and cup. Expressive, juicy-vibrant malic acidity; very syrupy, viscous mouthfeel. Impossibly long, harmonious, all-inclusive finish.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 25 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply rich, roast-rounded, floral-toned. Cocoa nib gardenia, marjoram, clove, black cherry in aroma and small cup. Very viscous, syrupy mouthfeel; long, flavor-laden finish. In three parts milk, integrated, coherent, balanced.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu Maganjo AA TOP
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Red currant, dark chocolate, thyme, lime zest, coconut in aroma and cup. Very sweet, also very tart acidity (intense, phosphoric); plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Intensely sweet-savory, long-lingering finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed at the Maganjo mill by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral, vibrantly layered. Star jasmine, cocoa nib, peach, myrrh, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Juicy-tart, balanced acidity; silky, energetic mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish that makes good on the promise of the cup.
Notes: Southern Ethiopia produces distinctive coffees from largely indigenous, traditional selections of Arabica long grown in the region. Coffees like this one, processed by the traditional wet or washed method (fruit skin and pulp is removed before drying), typically express great aromatic complexity and intensity. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, very sweet. Almond nougat, red plum, maple syrup, baking chocolate, pink grapefruit in aroma and cup. Juicy, malic acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Resonant finish consolidates to notes of maple syrup and pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by Luis Pedro Zelaya Zamora of Hacienda Carmona, from trees of the Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama G1 Bona Zuria Ayele Tulu Honey
Coffee Origin: Bona Zuria Woreda, Sidamo growing region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Lychee, agave syrup, fresh-cut oak, sassafras, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet, delicate acidity; plush, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of agave syrup, oak and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the 74110, 74112, 74158 and 74165 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: San Jose de Minas, Pichincha, Ecuador
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, brightly and sweetly herbaceous. Pineapple, cocoa nib, bay leaf, tangerine, lavender in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with sparkling acidity; syrupy, viscous mouthfeel. Cocoa-driven finish with undertones of pineapple and lavender.
Notes: Produced by Galo Fernando Morales Flores and Maria Alexandra Rivera of Finca Cruz Loma, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ka‘ū growing district, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Elegantly sweet-tart, richly floral, complex. Narcissus, tamarind, rice pudding, hazelnut, pink grapefruit in aroma and cup. Sparkling, vibrant acidity; plushly satiny mouthfeel. Floral-toned, multi-layered finish that carries over all the flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 12 coffee on

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Huke Premium Washed G1
Blind Assessment: Nuanced, delicate, multi-layered. Sweetly spice-toned, gently herbaceous, richly aromatic. Bergamot, cocoa nib, pink peppercorn, freesia, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Balanced, apple-like (malic) acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, satiating finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bear Lake Coffee Co., a B Corp-certified coffeehouse and roastery located in Barronett, Wisconsin, is committed to sustainability through its Coffee with a Purpose™ initiative, which ensures that farmers receive compensation well above the Fairtrade Premium for their exceptional small-batch coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Huke Premium Natural G1
Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, richly chocolaty. Blueberry, cashew, dark chocolate, lemon verbena, sassafras in aroma and cup. Citrusy acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of blueberry and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Bear Lake Coffee Co., a B Corp-certified coffeehouse and roastery located in Barronett, Wisconsin, is committed to sustainability through its Coffee with a Purpose™ initiative, which ensures that farmers receive compensation well above the Fairtrade Premium for their exceptional small-batch coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, juicy-tart, chocolaty. Dark chocolate, pie cherry, hazelnut, tangerine, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, citrusy acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pie cherry and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate, from trees of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Speedwell Coffee, based in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is a wholesale and retail specialty roaster particularly dedicated to offering attractive coffee subscription plans. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, vibrant. Apricot, almond nougat, lemongrass, star jasmine, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish showcases apricot, almond and star jasmine notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Deeply floral, richly perfumed. Tea rose, guava, cocoa nib, myrrh, graphite in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Flavor-laden finish centered around notes of tea rose, guava and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying), with the addition of select enzymes added to the fermentation. 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, floral-toned. Wisteria, dark chocolate, red plum, hazelnut, marjoram in aroma and cup. Lively, sparkling acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and wisteria with undertones of marjoram.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned. Quince, clove, orange zest, rhododendron, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Quince and clove notes carry the rich-toned finish.
Notes: Produced at Ibonia Estate, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Gichugu Division, Kirinyaga County, central Kenya
Blind Assessment: Balanced, sweetly savory. Red currant, almond nougat, cocoa nib, pink grapefruit zest, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Crisp, citrusy acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Red currant and cocoa nib lead in the confident finish, with undertones of pink grapefruit zest.
Notes: Produced by the smallholders of the New Ngariama Farmers Cooperative Society from trees of the SL-28, Ruiru 11 and Batian varieties of Arabica. Processed at Kamwangi Washing Station by the particularly meticulous Kenya variation on the traditional wet or “washed” method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried).  Speedwell Coffee, based in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is a wholesale and retail specialty roaster particularly dedicated to offering attractive coffee subscription plans. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, delicately fruit-toned. Dark chocolate, yellow plum, almond, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish supported by notes of yellow plum and cedar.
Notes: A blend of coffees that’s 50% washed Colombia; 40% washed Ethiopia and 10% natural-processed Ethiopia. Cupping Room was founded in 2011 in Hong Kong and now has seven coffee shops across the city. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Oromi Guji Hamela Wamena Tirtira Goyo Natural G1
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, vibrantly aromatic. Tangerine, dried mulberry, dark chocolate, hazelnut, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-saturated finish that carries over all the aroma and flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Dou Zhai Coffee & Roastery is a Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster and cafe. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately floral, richly sweet. Narcissus, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, red apple, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Long, resonant, lingering finish centered around notes of narcissus and cocoa nib with lemon verbena undertones.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia (one washed and one natural processed) and Costa Rica (honey processed). Dou Zhai Coffee & Roastery is a Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster and cafe. Visit

Blind Assessment: Multi-layered, deep-toned. Candied violet, oolong tea, mulberry, frankincense, shiitake in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with delicately bright acidity; quite syrupy mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 3 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Gooseberry, hazelnut, narcissus, dark chocolate, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Bright, malic acidity; very full syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Kent and N39 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, berry-toned. Blueberry jam, hazelnut, cocoa nib, cedar, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; very syrupy, viscous mouthfeel. Blueberry notes carry the cocoa-toned, cedary finish.
Notes: CMYK’s red series is comprised of “90+ fresh-crop rotating natural-processed” coffees. CMYK is a Billings, Montana-based coffee roaster that offers four primary coffees (like primary colors) that you can order “pure” or custom-blended to your own specifications. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Citrusy sweet, high-toned. Tangerine, dark chocolate, almond, date, sassafras in aroma and cup. Sparkling, juicy acidity; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of tangerine and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced at Mapache Estates, Finca El Naranjito, entirely of the Pacas variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, richly nutty. Cashew, red apple, baking chocolate, nutmeg, oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quiet, chocolaty finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the ACODIHUE Cooperative, from trees of the Bourbon, Catimor, Caturra, Maragogype and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, balanced. Date, brown sugar, pink grapefruit zest, marjoram, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Delicately bright acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish with notes of date and pink grapefruit zest.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Drink Coffee Do Stuff operates a roastery in Truckee, California, and a coffee shop in nearby Incline Village, Nevada. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly layered, vibrant, engaging. Nectarine, aromatic orchid, almond paste, frankincense tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Intricate, richly layered structure with juicy acidity; viscous, very silky mouthfeel. Perfumed, crisply sweet-tart, rich-toned finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 8 coffee on

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, cocoa-driven. Wisteria, cocoa nib, apricot, almond, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Delicately bright, balanced acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-saturated, floral finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Coffee Origin: Perez Zeldon, San Jose, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, richly chocolaty. Baking chocolate, orange zest, coconut, apple blossom, nougat in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Nougaty finish with undertones of orange zest.
Notes: Produced by Don Senel of Finca La Toboba, entirely of the ed Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the red honey method, in which much of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process.

Coffee Name: El Salvador Ojo de Agua Carlos Poa
Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, sweetly savory. Red plum, freesia, cocoa nib, agave syrup, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Sweet-toned finish centered around notes of freesia and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by Carlos Poa of Finca Las Brisas, entirely of the Pacas variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit.

Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, crisply caramelly. Brown sugar, rhododendron, date, honey, fir in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; quite full, creamy mouthfeel. Brown sugar and fir notes carry the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Red Catuai and Yellow Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method and decaffeinated at the Descamex plant in Mexico by a water-only process that does not involve the use of solvents.

Blind Assessment: Bright, balanced, juicy. Guava, dark chocolate, almond nougat, narcissus, tangerine in aroma and cup. Sparkling, phosphoric acidity; vibrant, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, tropical finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Asobombo Cooperative, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, very sweet. Rhododendron, black cherry, fresh sugarcane, baking chocolate, hazelnut in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of rhododendron and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Wilson Sucaticona, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Coffee Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Special Nano Geisha Gigante Washed Euphora Lot
Blind Assessment: Intricate, delicate, laser-focused. Lychee, bergamot, cocoa nib, lemongrass, myrrh in aroma and cup. Lyrically balanced, juicy, high-toned acidity; very smooth, viscous, silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering harmonious, resonant finish.
Notes: Produced at Hacienda La Esmeralda, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Euphora is a Taipei-based specialty coffee roaster with an active online community through which all sales are made. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Black Diamond Bourbon
Coffee Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Very bright and juicy, tropical-leaning. Kiwi, lychee, dark chocolate, pikake flower, dried mandarin in aroma and cup. Vivid, expressively bright acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Fruity, chocolaty, very long and flavor-saturated finish that leads with notes of kiwi and dark chocolate.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 20 coffee on

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Balanced, high-toned, multi-layered. Dried plum, genmaicha tea, lemon balm, candied violet, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Notes of dried plum and genmaicha tea are foregrounded in the pleasing finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local landrace varieties, and processed at the Biru Bekele Washing Station by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).

Coffee Name: Finca La Secreta Colombia Lychee Co-Ferment
Blind Assessment: Sweetly fruit-toned, crisply floral. Distinct lychee, freesia, baking chocolate, amber, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with notes of lychee and amber.
Notes: Produced by Juan Carlos Mejia of Finca La Secreta, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment), co-fermented with lychee, then dried in the whole fruit..

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama Berry Mousse Natural G1
Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, richly sweet. Raspberry coulis, almond, green grape, freesia, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to pretty notes of raspberry and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Citrus Glow Washed G1
Blind Assessment: Cocoa-toned, gently fruity. Cocoa nib, red plum, caramel, tangerine, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Bright, sweetly tart acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-driven finish with undertones of tangerine and lemon verbena.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, berry-toned. Blackberry, hazelnut, baking chocolate, marjoram, fir in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweetly herbaceous finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Kinini Coffee Cooperative, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit).  True Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe in Wisconsin whose motto is, “On a never-ending quest to bring you a great cup of coffee, by staying true to the bean.” Visit

Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, quietly confident. Dried plum, baking chocolate, hazelnut, brown sugar, lily in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet, citrusy acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of dried plum and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit).

Coffee Name: Natural Brazil Peaberry from Black Coffee Producers
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, nut-toned. Cashew butter, goji berry, orange zest, freesia, oak in aroma and cup. Sweet, gentle acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is centered around sweet cashew and orange zest notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). True Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe in Wisconsin whose motto is, “On a never-ending quest to bring you a great cup of coffee, by staying true to the bean.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy, berry- and citrus-toned. Mulberry, tangelo zest, cherimoya, freesia, fresh-cut pine in aroma and cup. Brisk, bittersweet acidity; plush, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Richly sweet finish that leads with notes of mulberry and tangelo zest.
Notes: A blend comprised of three natural-processed coffees: a Java, Indonesia, a Burundi and an Ethiopia. Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Coffee Origin: Arbegona Woreda, Bursa Kebele, Sidamo Region, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, dried apricot, walnut, magnolia, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty supported by notes of dried apricot and walnut.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, tangily fruity. Red currant, cocoa nib, pineapple kefir, lime zest, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Pert, acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to cocoa nib and pineapple kefir.
Notes: A blend of two coffees, a traditional washed Kenya and an anaerobically processed Colombia. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, multi-layered. Apricot, almond, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Gently bright, balanced acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Sweetly herbaceous finish supported by cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This version is processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, cocoa-toned. Baking chocolate, caramel, hazelnut, red grape, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Caramelly finish with undertones of hazelnut and cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed at the Heza Washing Station by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). BigFace Coffee is NBA player Jimmy Butler’s lifestyle brand. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, complex, bittersweet. Dark chocolate, sweet tobacco, dried fig, nutmeg, molasses in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Brisk finish carried by dark chocolate and tobacco notes.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Sumatra, Indonesia (wet-hulled), Colombia (washed) and Kenya (washed). Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew butter, orange zest, agave syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sparkling acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to baking chocolate and cashew with oak undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding women farmers and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Dios Mio is a Florida-based coffee company that exclusively features women-farmed Colombia coffees. Visit

Coffee Name: Brown Bear Melange AKA Kyle’s Blend
Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, smoky-sweet. Chocolate fudge, dried plum, scorched mesquite, molasses, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Round, barely perceptible acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with notes of tangerine zest and scorched mesquite.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Africa, Indonesia and Central America, roasted separately then blended as a melange on collaboration with actor Kyle McLachlan. Walla Walla Roastery is a Washington-based coffee roaster and cafe specializing in seasonal single-origin coffees and house blends. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, briskly sweet. Baking chocolate, almond, brown sugar, date, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet, apple-like acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Nutty-sweet finish supported by cedar notes.
Notes: A blend of washed coffees from Central and South America, roasted for Ralph Lauren by La Colombe Torrefaction. Certified USDA Organic. Visit

Blind Assessment: Quietly sweet, nut-toned. Brazil nut, cocoa powder, lily, raisin, fir in aroma and cup. Sweet but somewhat harsh acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Dry, wood-framed finish with hints of Brazil nut and lily.
Notes: Comprised of coffees from Brazil and Colombia. Happy is a coffee brand founded by actor Robert Downey, Jr. and business entrepreneur Craig Dubitsky in 2024. Visit

Blind Assessment: Roast-muted, chocolaty and smoky. Scorched fir, baking chocolate, salted peanut, bay leaf, hint of gardenia in aroma and cup. No perceptible acidity; rough-edged, slightly astringent mouthfeel. Dry, peanutty finish with smoky wood and chocolate undertones.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Peru and Nicaragua. Chamberlain Coffee is YouTube influencer Emma Chamberlain’s coffee brand. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet-savory, muted. Carob, lily, stale raisin, fir, sassafras in aroma and cup. Harsh acidity; thin, inert mouthfeel. Carob-driven finish with undertones of lily and sassafras.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia and Brazil. Central Perk Coffee Co. is Chef Tom Colicchio’s Boston-based cafe with a

Blind Assessment: Acrid, bittersweet. Carob, lily, raisin, scorched fir, green bean in aroma and cup. Burnt, bitter structure with only vague sweetness; thin, cloying mouthfeel. Ashen, medicinal flavor dominates the bitter finish.
Notes: A coffee of undisclosed origin, evaluated in pre-ground format. Founded by actor Tom Hanks to support veterans and their families, HANX donates 100% of its profits to organizations that provide resources and support to those who have served in the U.S military. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Burnt, acrid, harsh, sweetly composty. Charcoal, floral soap, stale walnuts, vegetal compost, hint of medicinal taint in aroma and cup. Sharp, harsh acidity; cloying, tannic, heavy mouthfeel. Composty, medicinal finish.
Notes: Comprised of 100 percent Honduras coffee, certified organic by CCOF. Rudy is Rudy Giuliani’s coffee brand, founded during his bankruptcy case involving a $148 million judgment against him for defamation. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently fruity, cocoa-toned. Blueberry, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Crisp, briskly sweet acidity; very smooth, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned blueberry and cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Kurume variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit).

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory. Cashew, cocoa powder, goji berry, bay leaf, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Sweetly nutty finish with undertones of cocoa powder and brown sugar.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Kenya and Brazil.

Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, sweetly tart. Raspberry, salted caramel, lemon balm, dried goji berry, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly-tart acidity; plush syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, berry-toned finish supported by notes of lemon balm and caramel.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of Cooperativa El Porvenir, from trees of the Yellow Catuai, Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Old World Coffee Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit

Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, intensely sweet. Dried mulberry, marjoram, cocoa nib, freesia, watermelon candy in aroma and cup. Lively, sparkling (phosphoric) acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Concentrated finish carried by dried mulberry and freesia notes with undertones of cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with wine yeasts. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. This special release is available to members of modcup’s Deepcuts list. Visit

Blind Assessment: Complex, richly sweet-tart. Strawberry-guava, kumquat, narcissus, raw cacao, amber in aroma and cup. Juicy, citric acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Flavor-laden finish led by notes of strawberry-guava and amber with support from kumquat.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Yellow Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with wine yeasts.

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Roast-rounded, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, pie cherry, gently scorched oak, lily, sassafras in aroma and cup. Satiny mouthfeel; gently drying, chocolaty, wood-framed finish with subtle smoke notes. In cappuccino format, sweet chocolate notes carry the cup, with undertones of lilly and gently scorched oak.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Kenya, Guatemala and Ethiopia (the latter of which is natural-processed) roasted for espresso applications. Domain Coffee is a Taipei-based specialty roaster. Visit

Coffee Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Blind Assessment: High-toned, richly chocolaty. Dark chocolate, magnolia, hazelnut, pink peppercorn, lemongrass in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The chocolaty, sweetly nutty finish is redolent of Nutella.
Notes: Produced by Rene Contreras on the family farm in Monte Verde and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Speedwell Coffee, based in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is a wholesale and retail specialty roaster particularly dedicated to offering attractive coffee subscription plans. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Chocolaty-sweet, rich-toned. Pomegranate, baking chocolate, almond,gently scorched fir, dark caramel in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty finish with almond and smoky fir undertones. In three parts milk, chocolaty and floral (magnolia notes emerge).
Notes: Bluekoff is a Thai company involved in all aspects of coffee, from milling and roasting to coffee wholesale and retail and related equipment and training services. Bluekoff produces more than 1,200 tons of green coffee and 1,000 tons of roasted coffee per year. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Gesha Thermal Shock Wine Yeast
Blind Assessment: Very sweet, tropical and floral-toned. Vanilla orchid, guava, dried ginger, kola nut, lemongrass in aroma and cup. Vibrant, juicy acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Exceptionally long, harmonious, integrated finish.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 28 coffee on

Coffee Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Striped Bourbon Thermal Shock
Blind Assessment: Bright, juicy, floral-toned. Tangerine, plumeria (frangipani) red plum, cocoa nib, tarragon in aroma and cup. Sparkling (phosphoric) acidity; delicately satiny, very smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish carries over all the flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Striped Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with wine yeasts. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart, complex. Sweetly herbaceous, citrusy. Cocoa nib, kumquat, lemon thyme, amber, sugarcane in aroma and cup. Balanced, malic (apple-like) acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Herby, cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy-sweet, deep-toned. White peach, narcissus, cocoa nib, oak, almond in aroma and cup. High-toned acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-driven, floral finish.
Notes: Certified USDA Organic. Produced by smallholding farmers of the Danche community, from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Wonderstate Coffee, formerly Kickapoo Coffee, is an award-winning roaster based in rural Wisconsin known for its commitment to guaranteeing higher pay for farmers and operating the country’s first 100% solar-powered roastery. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, very sweet. Butterscotch, pistachio, tangerine, black cherry, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, vibrant acidity; crisp, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Inviting finish centered around notes of butterscotch and tangerine.
Notes: Produced by Henry Gonzalez of Finca Sinaí, entirely of the Colombia variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, gently herbaceous. Meyer lemon zest, bay leaf, baking chocolate, date, myrrh in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Especially long, vibrant finish with lingering notes of baking chocolate, date and myrrh.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Gran Paraiso 92, from trees of the Colombia and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and decaffeinated in Colombia using ethyl acetate, a solvent derived from sugar cane. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, chocolaty. Baking chocolate, heavy cream, orange zest, date, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of orange zest and date.
Notes: A USDA-certified organic coffee from Cusco, Peru (San Fernando Cooperative), processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Wonderstate Coffee, formerly Kickapoo Coffee, is an award-winning roaster based in rural Wisconsin known for its commitment to guaranteeing higher pay for farmers and operating the country’s first 100% solar-powered roastery. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Gesha Village Oma Gesha 1931 Natural
Blind Assessment: Lush, floral, deeply aromatic, floral-toned. Wisteria, pink peppercorn, dried mango, bergamot, cocoa nib  in aroma and cup. Delicately bright, vibrant acidity; full, syrupy smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, floral finish with undertones of pink peppercorn.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 29 coffee on

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Djimma Limu Gummay Baby Geisha Washed
Coffee Origin: Djimma Limu, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: High-toned, richly sweet-tart, citrusy. Wild honey, sandalwood, pomelo, lavender, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Flavor-laden finish redolent of wild honey and lavender supported by cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers associated with SNAP Coffee, from trees of the Wolisho, Dega, 74110 and 74112 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere Halo Hartume Washed G1
Blind Assessment: High-toned, delicately juicy. Apricot, almond, magnolia, bergamot, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and apricot.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Brocade Coffee is a Taiwan-based specialty roaster. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, even-keeled, nuanced. Dark chocolate, plum blossom, maple syrup, date, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Delicately bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated finish centers around notes of dark chocolate and plum blossom.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74112 variety of Arabica, and processed by the  traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, sweetly tart, chocolaty. Dark chocolate, Bing cherry, roasted almond, grapefruit zest, marjoram in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of grapefruit and almond.
Notes: Produced at Zuoyuan Farm in Yunnan, China, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). The “biodynamic” process refers to micro-sampling control technology that allows observation of the local microbes and their development, as well as the use of technology to block ultraviolet light (thought to diminish aromas) during the drying procese. Gee Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster with 12 cafes in Guangzhou and Shenzhen, China. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Gedeo Yirgacheffe Gerbota Washed G1
Blind Assessment: Crisp, brightly sweet-savory. Apricot, lemon balm, baking chocolate, cedar, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with bright acidity; lightly satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Quiet finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers associated with SNAP Coffee, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, well-balanced. Baking chocolate, date, magnolia, cedar, orange est in aroma and cup. Bright, vibrant acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish supported by notes of cedar and orange zest.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia, Guatemala and El Salvador. Cafe Choisi is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit Cafe Choisi’s

Blind Assessment: Gently tart, fruit-toned. Raspberry, fresh-cut fir, cocoa powder, orange zest, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweetly tart acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with cocoa powder and orange zest undertones.
Notes: Produced on Ali Mountain in Alishan, Taiwan, entirely of the SL34 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Deludelu Coffee Roasters is a specialty nano-roaster based in Taipei. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew butter, sassafras, orange zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centered around notes of cashew and oak.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Serrania, from trees of the Colombia, Caturra and Castillo varieties of Arabica, processed by the washed method and decaffeinated in Colombia using ethyl acetate, a solvent derived from sugar cane. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, chocolaty. Baking chocolate, hazelnut, lemon balm, cedar, lily in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet-toned acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and lily.
Notes: A rare coffee grown on the island of St. Helena, a British territory in the South Atlantic Ocean — a green-tipped Bourbon processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Sea Island Coffee is a London-based roaster specializing in rare origins and varieties. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas SL28 Double-Diamond Anaerobic Natural
Coffee Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, sweetly tart. Baking chocolate, almond butter, black cherry, pineapple kefir, sticky rice in aroma and cup. Sweet, even-keeled acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of baking chocolate and almond butter.
Notes: Produced by Francisca and Oscar Chacon of Finca Las Lajas, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). Lenny’s Lab is a Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster that wants to inspire its customers to “change one person’s life.” For more information, visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bensa Blue Donkey 24/1
Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, deeply sweet-tart. Dark chocolate, kumquat, amber, star jasmine, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart, malic acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Very long, focused finish with dark chocolate, complex citrus, and undertones of amber.
Notes: Guji is a coffee-growing region nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidama regions. Guji coffees are largely produced from distinctive landrace varieties of Arabica long grown there. Processed by the natural method (beans are dried in the whole fruit).  Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Peru Washed Los Santos Farm Gesha
Blind Assessment: High-toned, multi-layered. Milk chocolate, narcissus, date, pomegranate, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-laden, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca Los Santos, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Peru Black Honey Los Santos Farm Gesha
Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned, rich and deep. Bergamot, black tea, white nectarine, cocoa nib, sticky rice in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by sweet spice notes.
Notes: Produced at Finca Los Santos, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which much of the sticky fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, very sweet. Mulberry, bay leaf, tamarind, tangerine zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Balanced, high-toned acidity; quite syrupy mouthfeel. Tamarind and mulberry carry the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced at Nyeri Hill Estate, from trees of the SL34, SL28 and Ruiru varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently bright, deep-toned. Concord grape, sandalwood, fudgesicle, cashew, rhododendron in aroma and cup. Delicately bright, balanced acidity; very viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of Concord grape and rhododendron with fudgesicle undertones.
Notes: Produced at Finca Santa Monica, entirely of the Tabi variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Cocoa-toned, richly sweet-savory. Cocoa nib, red currant, hop flowers, almond butter, sugar cane in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by almond butter and sugar cane.
Notes: Produced by 1074 smallholding Farmers who work with Greenco Coffee, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly herbaceous, delicately fruity. Nectarine, sage, almond, coconut saltwater taffy, fir in aroma and cup. Briskly bittersweet acidity; very full, creamy mouth feel. Notes of sweet almond, sage and fir lead in the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced at My Liberica Farm, entirely of the Coffea Liberica species, a coffee native to central Africa and long cultivated in parts of Southeast Asia. Processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama West Arsi Nansebo Natural G1
Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, juicy-bright. Dried mango, honey, wisteria, tangerine, macadamia nut in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with vibrant, sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Dried mango and macadamia notes are supported by wisteria and tangerine in the confident finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Moonlight Delight Wine Process Natural
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Fruit-forward, sweetly fermenty. Guava, cocoa nib, narcissus, grappa barrel, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, very syrupy mouthfeel. Finish is cocoa-laden and fruity-tart.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of local landrace varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Raspberry, hazelnut, amber, cocoa nib, freesia in aroma and cup. Crisp, citrusy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Exceptionally resonant, lingering finish that carries over all the aroma and flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Comprised entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Tart-leaning, cocoa-toned. Cocoa powder, crabapple, marjoram, hazelnut, lily in aroma and cup. Briskly tart acidity; plush creamy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish is carob-like in its sweetness, supported by notes of sweet hazelnut.
Notes: Produced at Kateshi and Isanya Estates from trees of the Bourbon and Catimor varieties of Arabica and processed by the anaerobic natural method.  Side By Each Brewing Co. was a specialty roaster, craft brewery, kitchen, and community gathering space all under one roof in sunny Auburn, Maine.  The company closed permanently in December 2024.

Blind Assessment: Caramel-toned, richly wood-framed. Gently scorched fir, dark caramel, lily, raisin, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-savory acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with caramel undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and decaffeinated in Colombia using ethyl acetate, a solvent derived from sugar cane. Side By Each Brewing Co. is a specialty roaster, craft brewery, kitchen, and community gathering space all under one roof in sunny Auburn, Maine. The company closed permanently in December 2024.

Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, cocoa toned. Tamarind, cocoa powder, red apple, amber, freesia in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Tamarind and cocoa powder lead in the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of Los Cauchos Cooperative, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which in which, after skin and pulp removal, fermentation takes place in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are de-pulped and dried. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Candy-like, elegantly sweet. Juicy Fruit gum, Jolly Rancher, Nutella, sandalwood, mandarinquat in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Candy-sweet finish carried by notes of Juicy Fruit gum and Jolly Rancher.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Orange Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours.  JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, chocolaty. Baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, pie cherry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and pie cherry.
Notes: Produced by 459 farmers of the Dukunde Kawa Cooperative, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed at the Mbilima Washing Station by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Certified FTO. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Origin: San Marcos, Tarrazú growing region, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Guava kefir, hazelnut, dark chocolate, hint of aged grappa, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning, citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, enticing, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of CoopeTarrazú Cooperative, from trees of the F1 Hybrid (a cross between Sudan Rume and Villa Sarchi) variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet, complex. Chocolate fudge, narcissus, date, cedar, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of chocolate fudge and narcissus with undertones of date.
Notes: Produced at Aloha Hills Farm and processed by the washed method, in which the fruit skin and pulp are removed before the beans are dried. Maragogype is a lesser-known variety of Arabica that produces enormous beans. Visit

Blind Assessment: Boldly floral-toned, cocoa-driven. Honeysuckle, mulberry, dark chocolate, pistachio, pomelo in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart, malic (apple-like) acidity; plush, creamy  mouthfeel. The bright, resonant finish is as juicily confident as it is long.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers in the Bensa District of the Sidama Zone, from selections of landrace varieties of Arabica native to Ethiopia, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Bench Maji Baby Lucy Gesha
Blind Assessment: Lushly floral, deeply chocolaty. Star jasmine, dark chocolate, amber, lemon balm, bergamot in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet, balanced acidity; vibrant, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish supported by notes of bergamot and amber.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most sought-after coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Taiwan Natural Meishan Ching-Ye Farm Lot 0116
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart, juicy and bright. Dried apricot, cocoa nib, kumquat, maple syrup, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and pink peppercorn with undertones of kumquat.
Notes: Produced at Meishan Farm and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Brazil Ipanema Premier Cru Cherry Cold Drip
Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Richly sweet-tart, juicy-bright. Dark caramel, tangerine, guava, dark chocolate, hazelnut. Brightly sweet-tart, high-toned acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Sweet finish with notes of dark caramel and guava. Milk amplifies the sweetness and softens the tart fruit notes.
Notes: Prepared by the cold-drip method, in which a controlled dripper brews the coffee over 4-6 hours in the refrigerator, at a coffee-to-water ratio of 1:15. which involves prolonged steeping of ground coffee in cold water. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. The green coffee used is a Red Acacia produced by Fazenda Rio Verde. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply nuanced, elegant, rich-toned. Lavender, dark chocolate, passionfruit, amber, pineapple sage in aroma and cup. Juicy, vibrant acidity; very syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is long, juicy, resonant and bright.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lasso of Bella Alejandría Farm entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed anaerobic method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Mostra Coffee is a women-, minority-, veteran-, and immigrant-owned micro-roaster based in north county San Diego. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, bright, richly aromatic. Blackberry jam, hazelnut, baking chocolate, lemon verbena, sage in aroma and cup. Gently bright, citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Blackberry notes take center stage in the finish, with undertones of baking chocolate and lemon verbena.
Notes: Produced by the Restrepo Family and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart, balanced. Nectarine, almond butter, tangerine, fresh-cut oak, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. FInish consolidates to notes of nectarine and bay leaf.
Notes: Produced by Carmen Montoya, entirely of the Chiroso variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, floral- and spice-toned. Tea rose, nutmeg, pomegranate, lemon-thyme, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, apple-like (malic) acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Floral- and spice-toned finish with notes of tea rose and nutmeg.
Notes: Produced by the Bayter Family in collaboration with Nelson Martinez at Martinez’s farm, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Tangy-sweet, fruit-driven. Muscat grape, strawberry yogurt, dark chocolate, maple syrup, candycap mushroom in aroma and cup. Tangy, juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Dark chocolate and muscat notes are front and center in the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca Los Nogales, entirely of the Yellow Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed anaerobic method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately fruit-toned, richly bittersweet. Lychee, raspberry, cocoa nib, sassafras, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; lightly syrupy, quite viscous mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by lychee and sassafras.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which in which, after skin and pulp removal, fermentation takes place in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are de-pulped and dried. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Dried plum, baking chocolate, lemon zest, thyme, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently crisp finish with notes of baking chocolate and lemon zest.
Notes: Produced by Robinson Rivera of Finca El Silencio, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, floral-toned. Dark chocolate, lily, almond, date, tamarind in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Crisp chocolate and sweet lily notes carry the resonant finish.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia and Indonesia. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, gently smoky. Cocoa butter, golden raisin, lily, scorched oak, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Low perceived acidity, roundly sweet structure; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of smoky cocoa and lily.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the CESMACH Cooperative from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Mundo Novo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Decaffeinated at the Descamex plant in Mexico by a water-only process that does not involve the use of solvents. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: Chelba Station , Yirgacheffe, Gedeo Zone, SNNPR,Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, fruit-prominent. Dried mango, papaya, toffee, dark chocolate, lilac in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Mango and toffee carry the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at the Chelba Washing Station. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Tanzania Karatu Acacia Hills Geisha Washed AB Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly sweet-tart, multi-layered. Black cherry, tamarind, lemon-thyme, cedar, magnolia in aroma and small cup. Very syrupy, viscous mouthfeel; tart-leaning finish with notes of tamarind and lemon-thyme. In cappuccino format, like cherry pie, equal parts sweet and tart.
Notes: Produced at Acacia Hills Coffee, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Dark chocolate, goji berry pineapple kefir, mint, jasmine in aroma and cup. Juicy, sweetly savory acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to dark chocolate and mint with hints of pineapple kefir.
Notes: A blend comprised of a washed Kenya and a double-anaerobic natural Colombia. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, gently tart. Apricot, almond butter, plumeria, tangerine, elm in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-toned acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Almondy finish with hints of tangerine and elm.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicate, intricate, complex. Blackberry jam, milk chocolate, pralines, magnolia, amber in aroma and cup. Vibrant, sparkling acidity; lithe, silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering, flavor-laden finish that carries all the aromas and flavors of the cup into the long.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Granja La Esperanza, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process.

Blind Assessment: Balanced, brightly sweet-tart. White peach, watermelon candy, agave syrup, pink grapefruit zest, lilac in aroma and cup. Floral-toned acidity; very silky-smooth mouthfeel. Lilac and watermelon notes carry the easygoing finish.
Notes: Produced by Don Luis Anibal Calderón of Finca Villa Betulia, entirely of the Papayo variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Mostra Coffee is a women-, minority-, veteran-, and immigrant-owned micro-roaster based in north county San Diego. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Fruit-toned, sweetly herbaceous. Lychee, guava, cocoa nib, pennyroyal, wisteria in aroma and cup. High-toned, confident acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Long, integrated finish centered around notes of guava and pennyroyal.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Granja La Esperanza, entirely of the Sudan Rume variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit).

Blind Assessment: Balanced, fruit-toned. Lychee, almond, green grape, red wine barrel, cardamom in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; round, viscous mouthfeel. Quietly intriguing finish that leads with notes of lychee and cardamom.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 30 coffee on
