Blind Assessment: Bright, juicy, intensely aromatic. Distinct green apple, kumquat, raw cacao, marjoram, wild honey in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning, citrusy acidity; quite full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply tart finish with notes of kumquat and cacao.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila of Finca Santa Monica, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method with the addition of green apple and wine yeasts to the fermentation. Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deep-toned, invitingly bittersweet. Pomegranate, hop flowers, maple syrup, lily, almond in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, sweetly tart finish. In cappuccino format, richly almondy with undertones of pomegranate and hop flowers.
Notes: A blend of undisclosed coffees, roasted for espresso applications. A small-batch specialty coffee roaster in Meriden, Kansas, Mighty Beast describes its coffee as “a liquid compass to get you through the wilderness.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly pungent, bold-toned. Baking chocolate, date, gently scorched oak, caramel, orange zest in aroma and cup. Briskly bittersweet acidity; full, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, caramelly finish with undertones of gently scorched oak and date.
Notes: A blend of undisclosed origins, roasted for brewed applications. A small-batch specialty coffee roaster in Meriden, Kansas, Mighty Beast describes its coffee as “a liquid compass to get you through the wilderness.” Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia La Palma Y Tucán Heroes Series Geisha
Blind Assessment: Candy-sweet. Watermelon bubble gum, candy apple, pineapple saltwater taffy, sandalwood, kumquat in aroma and cup. Delicately bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Very sweet finish centered around notes of watermelon bubble gum and pineapple saltwater taffy.
Notes: Produced by Felipe Sardi & Elisa María Madriñan at Finca La Palma Y El Tucán, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary “bio-innovation” method that involves fermenting the whole cherries in clay vessels with selected yeasts before pulping and drying. Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Uniquely composed, tangy-sweet. Dried apricot, pineapple kefir, dark chocolate, sandalwood, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Juicy, balanced acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of pineapple kefir and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which, after skin and pulp removal, fermentation takes place in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, multi-layered. Black cherry, hazelnut, agave syrup, tangerine, rich cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of black cherry and tangerine with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced on Riunggunung Estate, from trees of the Andungasari, Bor Bor, Katrika and Ateng varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly cocoa-toned, gently citrusy. Cocoa nib, pink grapefruit zest, red grape, marjoram, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila of Finca Santa Monica, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ngoma Sector, Nyaruguru District, Southern Province, Rwanda
Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, citrusy. Lemon verbena, pomelo, cocoa nib, almond butter, candied violet in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Almond and lemon verbena notes carry the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by 60 smallholding farmers of the Kiyonza Hill Group, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, balanced, bright. Dark chocolate, nectarine, lemon balm, fresh-cut oak, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Chocolate and nectarine center the confident finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca El Jordan, from trees of the Colombia, Caturra and Castillo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, fruit-forward. Mango, baking chocolate, lemongrass, honey, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Lemongrass and baking chocolate predominate in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Luis Calderon of Finca Betulia, entirely of the Caturron variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Bonlife Coffee Roasters is a woman-owned specialty roaster in Cleveland, Tennessee. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly pungent, rich-toned. Blackberry shrub, tangerine, cocoa nib, narcissus, amber in aroma and cup. Crisp, even-keeled acidity; smooth, silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering, harmonious and resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which, after skin and pulp removal, fermentation takes place in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned. Cashew butter, cocoa powder, date, freesia, fir in aroma and small cup. Viscous, syrupy mouthfeel; gently drying, cocoa-toned finish. In cappuccino format, chocolate and cashew notes are amplified, while florals recede.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia (washed), Brazil (natural), Nicaragua (washed) and Mexico (washed), roasted for espresso applications. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Roast-rounded; sweetly wood-framed. Fresh-cut cedar, golden raisin, Brazil nut, sassafras, pomegranate in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; cedary finish with pomegranate undertones. In three parts milk, crisply chocolaty and gently sweet-tart.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Brazil (natural), Ethiopia (natural) and Honduras (washed), roasted for espresso applications. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama Orange Blossom Washed G1
Blind Assessment: Complex, sweetly citrusy. Bergamot, bay leaf, cocoa nib, violet, pink grapefruit in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Resonant, citrusy finish with notes of bergamot and pink grapefruit supported by cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Sidama Bensa Single Variety 74158
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, very fruity. Guava, lilac, pralines, cane sugar, calamansi in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with sparkling acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The rich-toned finish leads with notes of lilac and guava, supported by richly bitter-tart calamansi.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama Berry Gummies 74158 Natural G1
Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Watermelon candy, salted caramel, lemon balm, cedar, amber in aroma and cup. Balanced, juicy acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centers around notes of salted caramel and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Guji Floral Blueberry Natural G1
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, rich-toned. Dried blueberry, baking chocolate, gardenia, grapefruit zest, hazelnut in aroma and cup. Round, fruity acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Hazelnut and grapefruit zest predominate in the finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). 1980 Cafe is a Tainan City, Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned, delicately early. Roasted almond, date, baking chocolate, tamarind, fresh humus in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; crisply sweet, almondy finish. In three parts milk, date and tamarind notes take center stage, supported by baking chocolate.
Notes: Founded by a barista with a Ph.D. in Design, Raccoon Coffee is a specialty roaster whose green coffee selections come from “a rich tapestry of memory.” Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Tome Variety 74110
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Balanced, sweetly tart. Cocoa nib, apricot, narcissus, almond, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and apricot.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).

Blind Assessment: Complex, deep-toned, flavor-saturated. Satsuma, almond butter, narcissus, marjoram, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of satsuma and almond butter.
Notes: Produced by Luis Pedro Zelaya Zamora, from trees of the Bourbon, Red Caturra, Yellow Caturra and Catimor Hybrid varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Melony-sweet, deep-toned. Cantaloupe, amber, narcissus, bay leaf, cinnamon in aroma and cup. Gentle, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The sweet finish leads with notes of cantaloupe and amber.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 22 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, floral-toned. Watermelon candy, violet, orange soda, banana saltwater taffy, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Juicy, sparkling acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruity, rich-toned finish, long and lingering.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly herbaceous, deeply rich. Dark chocolate, pomegranate, lemongrass, cedar, magnolia in aroma and cup. Balanced, even-keeled acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish supported by pomegranate undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Ateng, Bor Bor, Catimor and Timor varieties of Arabica, and processed at Iwannitosa Putra’s Putra Gayo wet mill by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet-savory, quietly complex. Tamarind, narcissus, hop flowers, brown sugar, marjoram in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant finish consolidates to notes of tamarind and narcissus.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Kent and N39 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). This sample consists entirely of peaberries, a kind of bean that results when the coffee fruit develops only a single, oval bean rather than the usual pair of flat-sided beans. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply spice-toned, fruit-centered. Mulberry, clove, candy apple, magnolia, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish with floral undertones.
Notes: Produced by Yusra, from trees of the Ateng, Bor Bor, Catimor and Timor varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet, gently tart. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, freesia, elm, bergamot in aroma and cup. High-toned, citrusy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of pink grapefruit and bergamot.
Notes: A blend of one washed and one natural-processed coffee from Ethiopia designed to bring out citrus notes in the cup. Coffeeland is a specialty coffee roastery with two locations, one in Chia-Yi, Taiwan, and one in Ontario, California. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia José Julián Giraldo Pink Bourbon Panela Sticky
Blind Assessment: Sweetly citrusy, nectar-like. Tangerine, dried apricot, agave syrup, amber, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Long, resonant flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by José Julián Giraldo of Finca El Diamante, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed at La Clarita Lab by the panela sticky (double-washed anaerobic) method, in which Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy, floral-toned, richly sweet-savory. Red currant, cocoa nib, star jasmine, pistachio, myrrh in aroma and cup. Sparkling (phosphoric) acidity; smooth, viscous mouthfeel. Quietly confident finish consolidates to notes of red currant and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Gatirima Cooperative, entirely of the SL34 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Coffee Name: Kenya Washed Kirinyaga Getuya AA Top
Blind Assessment: Elegantly sweet-savory, deeply nuanced, richly aromatic. Red currant, dark chocolate, plumeria, sandalwood, wild honey in aroma and cup. Juicy, sparkling acidity; very smooth, syrupy mouthfeel. Harmonious, integrated, very long finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers near the Getuya Washing Station and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Lychee, caramel, hazelnut butter, redwood, brown sugar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; integrated, coherent finish. In three parts milk, all of the notes from the straight shot carry over and freesia also emerges.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly chocolaty, tartly fruity. Dark chocolate, pomegranate, lemon verbena, cedar, orange blossom in aroma and small cup. Plush, viscous mouthfeel; chocolaty finish with undertones of orange blossom. In cappuccino format, pomegranate resurfaces as a bold counterpart to the chocolate throughline.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia and Guatemala, roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Guatemala Honey Finca El General Gesha
Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, deeply aromatic. Wisteria, bergamot, frangipane, frankincense, pluot in aroma and cup. High-toned, sweetly crisp acidity; very syrupy mouthfeel. Floral, citrusy finish supported by stone fruit.
Notes: Produced at Finca El General, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (some fruit flesh left on the beans during the drying process). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisp, juicy, high-toned. Dried mango, cocoa nib, lemon balm, thyme, magnolia in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart, green apple-like acidity; vibrantly silky mouthfeel. Fruit-forward finish, cocoa-toned, and supported by rich florals and sweet herbs.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, flavor-saturated. Black currant, magnolia, dark chocolate, candied walnut, hint of smoked paprika in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with elegantly juicy acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Richly chocolaty finish with undertones of black currant and candied walnut.
Notes: Produced by Mulugeta Tsige, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Mulugeta Tsige Washing Station. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Linarco Rodriguez Ospina Pink Bourbon Washed 94
Blind Assessment: Delicately bright, balanced, richly sweet-tart. Red plum and cocoa nib in the aroma, deepening into Meyer lemon zest, shortbread and lilac in the cup. Gently bright, vibrant acidity; plush, silky mouthfeel. Very rich, multi-layered finish, deeply aromatic finish.
Notes: Produced by Linarco Rodriguez Ospina, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Haro Adama Washed G1
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, pistachio, dark chocolate, lilac, honey in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with juicy acidity; very silky mouthfeel. The chocolaty supports top notes of bergamot and lilac.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the 74110 and 74112 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, red apple, maple syrup, bay leaf, clover blossom in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very syrupy, vibrant mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of baking chocolate and sweet red apple.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Finca La Papaya, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña / Black Honey Watermelon & Lulo Co-Ferment
Blind Assessment: Nectar-like, sweetly tart, rich-toned. Watermelon candy, cocoa butter, loquat, freesia, graphite in aroma and cup. High-toned, phosphoric acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Sweet, long, candy-like finish
Notes: Produced by Edwin Enrique Noreñ of Finca Campo Hermoso, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by carbonic maceration (which involves fermenting the whole fruit in a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2) and co-fermenting with watermelon and lulo, then dried with most of the fruit flesh remaining on the beans. Produced by Edwin Enrique Noreña, Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña / Black Honey Pink Bourbon Mosto & Passionfruit Co-Ferment
Blind Assessment: Tropical, deep, harmonious. Passionfruit, star jasmine, myrrh, cocoa nib, pineapple saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonantly fruity and floral finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Enrique Noreñ of Finca Campo Hermoso, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by carbonic maceration (which involves fermenting the whole fruit in a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2) and co-fermenting with Pink Bourbon mosto and passionfruit, then dried with most of the fruit flesh remaining on the beans. Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña Juice Box Processing Set / Natural Carbonic Maceration
Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, very, very sweet. Tea rose, candied apple, agave syrup, dark chocolate, orange marmalade in aroma and cup. Gently brisk acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Citrusy finish with undertones of tea rose.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Enrique Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by carbonic maceration (which involves fermenting the whole fruit in a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2), and dried in the whole fruit. Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña Pink Bourbon
Blind Assessment: Flavor-laden, aromatically exuberant. Passionfruit, elderberry, lemon-thyme, pomelo, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Tropical finish with fruit and sweet herb notes front and center.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Enrique Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by carbonic maceration (which involves fermenting the whole fruit in a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2) and co-fermented with mixed berries and passionfruit, and dried with most of the fruit flesh remaining on the beans. Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly spice-toned, delicately sweet. Nutmeg, guava, narcissus, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Especially lush, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by the Merlaeku Family, from trees of the Catuai, Typica, and Chiang Mai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Little Waves Coffee is a Latina-owned, women-forward company that provides livable wages for its diverse team. Visit

Coffee Origin: Remera Sector, Gatsibo District, Eastern Province, Rwanda
Blind Assessment: Clean, harmoniously balanced. Mulberry, lychee, marjoram, azalea, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; elegant, silky mouthfeel. Berry-toned finish supported by notes of sweet herbs.
Notes: This exciting coffee was selected as the No. 17 coffee on

Blind Assessment: High-toned, sweetly tart. Watermelon candy, blueberry, freesia, hazelnut, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning, winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruity-sweet finish with undertones of freesia and cocoa nib.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia (one washed, one natural-processed). The Taiwanese pronunciation of DOHO (tú-hó) means “pure serendipity.” Doho Coffee Roasters has two stores and is dedicated to promoting coffee culture through the high quality of its products. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, nut-toned. Baking chocolate, Fig Newton, almond butter, Meyer lemon zest, magnolia in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisply sweet, nut-driven finish.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Guatemala, and Colombia, all processed by the washed method. The Taiwanese pronunciation of DOHO (tú-hó) means “pure serendipity.” Doho Coffee Roasters has two stores and is dedicated to promoting coffee culture through the high quality of its products. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly nut-toned. Cashew butter, caramel, oak, lily, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Cashew and brown sugar notes carry the finish.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Kenya and Brazil. Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Blind Assessment: Balanced, bright, fruit-forward. Dried plum, almond, freesia, honey, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned, round acidity; plush creamy mouthfeel. Especially resonant, flavor-laden finish that fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by Roberto Brenes of Auromar Estate, entirely of the Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Blind Assessment: Delicately bright, sweetly tart. Apricot, hazelnut, cocoa nib, lemon balm, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently sweet acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of hazelnut and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by Carlos Aguilera of Carmen Estate, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Coffee Name: Kona Geisha Peaberry Yeast Fermentation Washed
Blind Assessment: Elegantly bright, floral-toned. Wisteria, lemongrass, dried nectarine, cocoa nib, bergamot in aroma and cup. Balanced, high-toned acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Long, lingering, satisfying finish
Notes: Produced at Kona Farm Direct, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method, with the addition of a yeast-inoculated fermentation step. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Coffee Origin: El Sapito, San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, Guatemala
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, delicately tart. Tamarind, dried mango, cocoa nib, marjoram, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet, gentle acidity; full, syrupy smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly tart finish.
Notes: Produced by David and Eddy Solano of Finca La Joya, entirely of the Red Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Roasted for Big Shoulders by guest roaster Mike Murdie of Metropolis Coffee. Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Floral-toned, sweetly tart. Bing cherry, ginger, wisteria, pink grapefruit zest, allspice. High-toned, juicy acidity; light, crisp mouthfeel. Tart, spice-toned finish. Perfection with milk, where wisteria notes are amplified and Bing cherry and ginger harmonize with pink grapefruit zest.
Notes: Prepared by the cold-brew method, which involves prolonged steeping of ground coffee in cold water. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. The green coffee used is a blend of two Costa Ricas, one washed and one honey-processed. Euphora is a Taipei-based specialty coffee roaster with an active online community through which all sales are made. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia El Paraiso Lychee Rose Cold Drip
Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Deep-toned, rich-tart-savory. Asian pear, pipe tobacco, pink peppercorn, blood orange, cocoa nib. Brightly sweet, delicately tart acidity; round, plump, very smooth mouthfeel. Crisply sweet-savory finish. Milk brings up the richness and savory impulses while also highlighting pipe tobacco notes.
Notes: Prepared by the cold-drip method, in which a controlled dripper brews the coffee over 4-6 hours in the refrigerator, at a coffee to water ratio of 1:15. which involves prolonged steeping of ground coffee in cold water. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. The green coffee used is a Castillo produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraiso 92, processed by the anaerobic natural method. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Brightly fruit-forward. Guava, magnolia, baking chocolate, lemon-thyme, cedar. Crisp, citrusy acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Guava and magnolia carry the clean finish. With milk, tart fruit notes recede and florals and chocolate are foregrounded.
Notes: Brewed hot, then chilled quickly without exposure to oxygen before being canned. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. The green coffee used is a single-origin Ethiopia from the Yirgacheffe growing region, wash-processed. Four Barrel is a café in San Francisco's Mission District with an in-house roasting facility. Visit

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Balanced, crisply chocolaty, sweetly nutty. Baking chocolate, hazelnut, rhododendron, fresh-cut oak, tangerine zest. Gentle, round acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Nut-driven finish with tangerine undertones. With a splash of milk, kind of like a Snickers bar with hazelnuts instead of almonds.
Notes: Produced by

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Crisply cocoa-toned, sweetly nutty. Cocoa powder, walnut, Valencia orange, bay leaf, caramel. Juicy, malic (apple-like) acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Richly bittersweet, walnutty and cocoa-toned finish. With milk, cocoa notes are amplified and walnut tones sweeten.
Notes: Produced by Snapchill in a proprietary process that involves brewing the coffee hot, then immediately chilling it to 38 degrees to prevent oxidation. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. Founded by George Howell in Boston in 2004, George Howell Coffee now operates three cafes and a roastery. Visit

Coffee Name: Extra Strong Cold Brew Straight Black
Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Deep-toned, flavor-saturated. Dark chocolate, date, cashew butter, vanilla bean, pink grapefruit zest. Gentle, sweetly brisk acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish supported by date and pink grapefruit zest. With milk, surprisingly bright — zest pink grapefruit is front and center with dark chocolate and date undertones.
Notes: Comprised of certified USDA Organic washed-process coffees from Peru, Mexico and Nicaragua, produced by a proprietary cold-brew method and flash-pasteurized for shelf stability prior to opening. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. Wandering Bear was founded in 2014 with the mission of producing strong, smooth, organic-certified cold brew in recyclable packaging. Visit

Coffee Name: Nice Nitro Organic Black Cold Brew Coffee
Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Deep-toned, balanced. Date, salted caramel, walnut, orange zest, gently smoky cedar. Round, smooth acidity; crisp, fluffy mouthfeel. Richly bittersweet finish driven by walnut and orange zest notes. Slightly smoky cedar notes play nicely with milk, alongside date, salted caramel and walnut.
Notes: A blend of Fair Trade Organic coffees from Colombia, Nicaragua, Honduras and Indonesia, cold-brewed for 24 hours at a ratio of one pound of coffee per gallon of water, and infused with nitrogen. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. Dean's Beans is a small batch wholesale roaster devoted to organic and sustainable principles and small-holder support. Visit

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Sweet-toned, caramelly. Dark caramel, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, fresh-cut fir, nutmeg. Briskly sweet acidity; wood-framed, sweetly caramelly finish. Complex caramel notes dominate when milk is added, complementing the lingering lemon verbena and nutmeg.
Notes: Comprised of coffees decaffeinated by the Select Water Process (origin undisclosed) and produced by Quivr using a proprietary cold-brew method, then infused with nitrogen. Contains no additives or ingredients other than coffee and water. Quivr is a Boston-based company founded by Ash Crawford and Mukunda Feldman to produce a range of coffee and tea products that are ethically sourced and high-quality. Visit

Blind Assessment: A ready-to-drink black coffee, tested cold. Crisply sweet-savory. Baking chocolate, hop flowers, Brazil nut, almond, gently scorched oak. Round, quiet acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Nut-driven finish with bittersweet floral undertones. Pleasantly and gently smoky with milk, with nice notes of bittersweet florals and baking chocolate.
Notes: Central American coffees from undisclosed countries are cold-brewed by a proprietary process, then filtered and canned. Blue Bottle Coffee is a specialty roaster with cafes in Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York and Japan now owned by Nestlé S.A. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Finca La Secreta Lychee Caturra Anaerobic
Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, richly fruity. Wisteria, lychee, kumquat, cocoa nib, marjoram in aroma and cup. High-toned, juicy acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Very floral finish with cocoa undertones.
Notes: Produced by Juan Carlos Mejia of Finca La Secreta, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method with the addition of lychee to the fermentation. Bear Lake Coffee Co., a B Corp-certified coffeehouse and roastery located in Barronett, Wisconsin, is committed to sustainability through its Coffee with a Purpose™ initiative, which ensures that farmers receive compensation well above the Fairtrade Premium for their exceptional small-batch coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Very fruit-forward, richly sweet. Lychee, kiwi, nectarine, freesia, tangerine zest on aroma and cup. Juicy, bright acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Lychee-laden finish with spicy floral undertones.
Notes: Produced by Juan Carlos Mejia of Finca La Secreta, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method with the addition of lychee to the fermentation. Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit

Coffee Name: Reserve Costa Rica Don Noel SL28
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, brightly sweet. Mulberry, sassafras, green tomato, cane sugar, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Bright, citrusy acidity; crisp, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Savory-leaning finish with a tomato-like umami undercurrent.
Notes: Produced by Allan Oviedo of Finca Don Noel, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the yellow honey method, in which a small percentage of fruit lesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Tipico Coffee is a café and specialty coffee roaster based in Buffalo, New York. Visit

Blind Assessment: Fruit-driven. Cranberry sauce, red grape, lychee, baking chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently sweet-tart acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with notes of cranberry and red grape supported by baking chocolate and cedar.
Notes: Produced by Francisco Mena of Finca Sumava de Lourdes, entirely of the Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Tipico Coffee is a café and specialty coffee roaster based in Buffalo, New York. Visit

Blind Assessment: Multi-layered, deeply sweet-tart. Candy apple, hibiscus tea, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Very sweet, candy-like finish.
Notes: Produced by Yeisson Calderon of Finca Villa Betuila, entirely of the Caturron variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, tropical-leaning. Magnolia, guava, green banana, amber, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet, malic acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned guava predominates in the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by Jamie Cardenas of Finca Sin Limites, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Tipico Coffee is a café and specialty coffee roaster based in Buffalo, New York. Visit

Coffee Origin: Bensa, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, deep-toned. Raspberry, tangerine, cocoa nib, lilac, myrrh in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; very smooth, silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering, harmonious and integrated finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 15 coffee on

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Djimma Limu Gummay Baby Geisha G1 Washed
Coffee Origin: Jimma Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Vibrant, balanced, impeccably sweet. Apricot, cocoa nib, bergamot, wild honey, Thai basil in aroma and cup. Lilting acidity; exceptionally silky-smooth mouthfeel. Very long finish that integrates and carries over all aroma and flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, floral-toned. Tea rose, watermelon candy, tamarind, cedar, wild honey in aroma and cup. in aroma and cup. High-toned, juicy acidity; crisp, creamy mouthfeel. Tea rose and watermelon candy carry the perfumed finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Finca La Papaya, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method with the addition of a yeast-inoculated fermentation step.  JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Palo de Rosa Pink Bourbon Colombia
Blind Assessment: Juicy-tart, bright, vibrant. Pomegranate, neroli, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; elegantly silky mouthfeel. Flavor-saturated finish centered around notes of pomegranate and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by 16 smallholding farmers in collaboration with Terra Coffee SASJBC, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) and adding a second fermentation step (double-washed). Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, brightly tart. Raspberry, narcissus, baking chocolate, salted caramel, pomelo in aroma and cup. Even-keeled acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruity finish supported by narcissus and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by 251 smallholding farmers of the Murata Commune, entirely of the Bourbon Mayaguez 139 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) with the addition of a whole-cherry yeast fermentation step. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, orange zest, lemon verbena, red plum, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and orange zest.
Notes: CMYK’s blue series is comprised of “90+ fresh-crop rotating SOuth American” coffees. CMYK is a Billings, Montana-based coffee roaster that offers four primary coffees (like primary colors) that you can order “pure” or custom-blended to your own specifications. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly tart, intriguingly complex. Tamarind, Jolly Rancher, dark chocolate, hop flowers, hint of marjoram in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; chocolaty-tart finish. Cappuccino format emphasis the marriage of sweet-tart-savory with bright fruit, candylike sweetness, and bittersweet floral undertones.
Notes: This outstanding coffee was selected as the No. 26 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, deep-toned. Dried plum, salted caramel, hazelnut, tangerine, magnolia in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, resonant finish centered around notes of dried plum and hazelnut.
Notes: Produced by members of the Women-Produced Smallholder Farmers Rambagirakawa Cooperative, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Rigoberto Herrera Granja La Esperanza Hybrid Washed Gesha
Blind Assessment: Lushly aromatic, deeply floral-toned. Wisteria, ginger blossom, nectarine, pink grapefruit, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Delicately bright, confident acidity; exceptionally silky-smooth mouthfeel. Notes of wisteria and ginger blossom harmonize alongside a throughline of nectarine and citrus undertones.
Notes: Produced by Rigoberto Herrera of Granja La Esperanza, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary hybrid washed method, in which the whole cherries are fermented in water for 19-22 hours. Then, the fruit is depulped and undergoes a second fermentation begins, this time in parchment and mucilage for 35 hours. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral, sweetly herbaceous. Star jasmine, bay laurel, dark chocolate, frankincense, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and frankincense.
Notes: Produced by Nestor Lasso of Finca El Diviso, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed thermal shock method in which the coffee fruit undergoes two stages of fermentation: First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Goca Coffee is a roastery and cafe in Taiching, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, sweetly savory. Pineapple kefir, cocoa nib, lavender, pink grapefruit zest, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-savory acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Especially long, lingering finish that extends the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by Don Hernando Laverde of Finca La Guirnalda, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed at La Palma y Tucan by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. In this case, lactic acid was added to the fermentation step. Blue Sail Coffee Roasters is an Arkansas roastery and cafe whose mission is “to inspire people to adventure more.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly chocolaty, deeply sweet-savory. Cocoa powder, salted caramel, golden raisin, gently scorched mesquite, agave syrup in aroma and small cup. Velvety-smooth mouthfeel; wood-framed, chocolaty finish. In cappuccino format, richly sweet and cocoa-toned with a nice salted-caramel throughline.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Brazil, Colombia and Guatemala, tested as espresso.

Blind Assessment: Crisply nutty, sweet-toned. Cashew butter, caramel, baking chocolate, lily, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Sweet, gentle acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Gently drying finish consolidates to notes of cashew and fir.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Costa Rica, Guatemala and Brazil. Virginia-based specialty roaster Pinup Coffee Co. focuses on affordable, accessible and carefully roasted coffees from all over the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy, sweet, fruit-saturated. Mulberry jam, dark chocolate, myrrh, pineapple kefir, black sage in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Notes of dark chocolate and mulberry commingle in the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Orange Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over-oxidation or continued fermentation. Big Shoulders Coffee is a Chicago artisan roaster that emphasizes a fresh-roasted, no-nonsense approach to fine coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, zesty, floral-toned. Tangerine, narcissus, cocoa nib, palm sugar, cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned, citric acidity; gently satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned tangerine notes lead in the finish, supported by hints of narcissus.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Dukunde Kawa Cooperative, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the triple-washed anaerobic method (the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel) at the Mbilima Washing Station. Certified USDA Organic and Fair Trade. SkyTop Coffee is a USDA-certified organic specialty coffee roaster based in Manlius, New York. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, vibrant, sweetly tart. Meyer lemon, cocoa nib, date, thyme, redwood in aroma and cup. Tartly sweet acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Notes of cocoa nib and Meyer lemon with thyme undertones in the finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Kinini Coffee Cooperative, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, gently fruity. Bing cherry, toffee, narcissus, cedar, sassafras in aroma and cup. Brisk, sweet acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Resonant finish centered around notes of toffee and narcissus.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely if the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at the Masha Washing Station. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Citrusy-sweet, gently herbaceous. Meyer lemon, marjoram, black cherry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet-tart, citrusy acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Meyer lemon and cedar notes lead in the finish, with undertones of agave syrup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Pomegranate, baking chocolate, hazelnut, rhododendron, oak in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pomegranate and baking chocolate, supported by oak.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Caturra, Colombia and Castillo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, juicy, deep-toned. Dark chocolate, wisteria, apricot, hazelnut, coconut in aroma and cup. High-toned, sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Long, harmonious, integrated finish that carries over the promise of the cup.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 13 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, deeply aromatic. Ripe blueberry, tangerine, dark chocolate, cedar, magnolia in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Blueberry-driven finish supported by dark chocolate and cedar.
Notes: Produced by Álvaro Andrés Cardona Molina and processed by the black honey method, in which much of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Founded in 2007 and named after the white rhino, which is both rare and social, White Rhino Coffee is based in Dallas, Texas and currently has nine coffee shops in addition to its roastery. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly spiced-toned, elegantly aromatic. Ginger blossom, nutmeg, lavender, lemon verbena, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Malic (apple-like) acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish into the long.
Notes: Produced by Diego Bermudez of Finca El Paraiso, entirely of the Castillo K-01 variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic washed method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel (and includes the addition of alcohols yeasts) before the beans are washed and dried. Jaunt Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based roaster and café with an extensive coffee and food menu. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidama G4 Wamena Natural Espresso
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Brightly sweet-tart, chocolaty. Pomegranate, dark chocolate, goji berry, almond butter, cedar in aroma and small cup. Plush, creamy mouthfeel; crisp, tartly chocolaty finish. In cappuccino format, dark berry notes take over from tart fruit while almond butter is amplified.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, deeply fruity. Passionfruit, tea rose, frangipane, cocoa nib, pineapple kefir in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright, balanced acidity; delicate, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Tea rose and cocoa nib carry the crisp finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit is first sterilized and then fermented in a bio-reactor.

Blind Assessment: Very sweet, complexly fruit-forward. Red plum, mango, freesia, cocoa nib, nougat in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned, fruity finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Bermudez of Finca El Paraiso, entirely of the Castillo YN-05 variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of yellow-fruit yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Jaunt Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based roaster and café with an extensive coffee and food menu. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Cauca Finca EI Paraiso 92 Pink Bourbon
Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet, deeply fruit- and cocoa-toned. Raspberry jam, dark chocolate, thyme, peach, frankincense in aroma and cup. Balanced, vibrant acidity;very silky, very smooth mouthfeel. Jammy cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Granja Paraiso 92, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over-oxidation or continued fermentation. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Copey Black Honey
Blind Assessment: Gently fruity, richly sweet. Goji berry, amber, cocoa nib, tangerine, lilac in aroma and cup. Delicate, round acidity; syrupy, viscous mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by rich amber impulses.
Notes: Produced at Hacienda Copey, entirely of the Villa Sarchi variety of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but virtually all of the pulp is allowed to dry on the beans, often resulting in a deep, pungent profile. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Guji Kercha Sakicha Red Honey 74112
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, nicely crisp. Pomegranate, freesia, pistachio, oak, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; crisp, creamy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centered around notes of pistachio and oak.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74112 variety of Arabica, and processed by the red honey method, in which much of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Floral-toned. Narcissus, orange zest, dark chocolate, marjoram, lychee in aroma and cup. Very sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish supported by notes of dusky marjoram and orange zest.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Costa Rica (a washed and a black honey) and a Colombia (double-anaerobic). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately fruity, crisply nut-toned. Mulberry, hazelnut, baking chocolate, orange zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Mulberry and baking chocolate are supported by hazelnut in the quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). San Diego-based Talitha Coffee Roasters has a core mission of advocating for and empowering survivors of sex trafficking through the business model of sourcing and serving ethically sourced coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, bright, nut-toned. Hazelnut, cocoa nib, nougat, cedar, freesia in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Solid finish that leads with hazelnut and cocoa nib with freesia undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Asodiett Cooperative, Beacon Coffee Roasters is a Bozeman, Montana-based roaster specializing in small-batch, fair trade-certified coffees from all over the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, chocolaty. Cocoa powder, date, Brazil nut, lily, fir in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. Gently drying, wood-framed finish with notes of date and cocoa powder.
Notes: A blend of washed and natural-processed coffees of undisclosed origin. San Diego-based Talitha Coffee Roasters has a core mission of advocating for and empowering survivors of sex trafficking through the business model of sourcing and serving ethically sourced coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned, crisply nutty. Cashew butter, nutmeg, caramel, orange zest, hint of mace in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quiet nut-driven finish with undertones of orange zest.
Notes: Produced by Celestin and Marie Rumernerangabo, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Beacon Coffee Roasters is a Bozeman, Montana-based roaster specializing in small-batch, fair trade-certified coffees from all over the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply cocoa-toned, sweetly nutty. Cocoa powder, walnut, molasses, pie cherry, fir in aroma and small cup. Taut, lightly satiny mouthfeel; gently drying, wood-framed finish. In cappuccino format, richly chocolaty with undertones of walnut and molasses.
Notes: A blend of Peru (washed), Guatemala (washed) and Sumatra (wet-hulled) coffees, roasted for espresso applications. Beacon Coffee Roasters is a Bozeman, Montana-based roaster specializing in small-batch, fair trade-certified coffees from all over the world. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Mokka Anaerobic Natural Finca Hawaii
Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned, complex and satiatingly fruity. Black cherry kombucha, clove, pipe tobacco, molasses in aroma and cup. Lively, sparkling acidity; creamy, lithe mouthfeel. Incredibly long, harmonious, integrated finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 5 coffee on

Coffee Origin: Holualoa, North Kona District, “Big Island” of Hawaiʻi
Blind Assessment: High-toned, tropical, exquisitely balanced. Orange blossom, cocoa nib, guava, young ginger, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright yet delicate acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish that fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced at Noelani Farm, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Coffee Name: Black Basalt Dark Roast Blend Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply chocolaty, rich-toned. Baking chocolate, scorched mesquite, freesia, date, cashew in aroma and cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; sweetly smoky, chocolaty finish. Chocolaty, nut-toned finish. In cappuccino format, rich, almost fudgelike chocolate predominates.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Honduras, Nicaragua and Thailand (both Arabica and Robusta), roasted for espresso applications. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, juicy, sweetly tart. Pomegranate, lychee, honey, amber, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; plush, syrupy mouthdeel. Fruit-driven finish supported by amber and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by 14 smallholding farmers in La Argentina, Palestina, Timaná and Ororapa municipalities in Huila, entirely of the Java variety of Arabica, and processed by a double-fermentation method, first in the whole cherry and then after de-pulping. Achilles Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based specialty roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently tart, delicately high-toned. Meyer lemon zest, cocoa nib, narcissus, agave syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Balanced, malic (apple-like) acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of sweet citrus and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmer members of COOPAC, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Coffee Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon Anaerobic
Coffee Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Complex, richly nuanced. Narcissus, cocoa nib, pear, wild honey, amber in aroma and cup. Invigorating, malic acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Very long-lasting, floral-toned, richly sweet finish.
Notes: Produced by Karen and Lee Paterson of Hula Daddy Farm, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica (grown on Hula Daddy’s higher-elevation farm), and processed by the anaerobic washed method with the addition of yeasts to the fermentation.  Evaluated as medium roast.  This presentation of the coffee is named for co-owner Karen Paterson, whose middle name is Jue and whose favorite coffee is the Red Bourbon. Hula Daddy is a boutique coffee producer with farms at the 1,400 and 2,500-foot levels of the Mount Hualalai volcano near the northern end of the Kona growing district, five minutes above the town of Kailua-Kona. Visit

Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Fruit-driven, richly floral. Boysenberry, lilac, cocoa nib, honey, cedar in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruity, floral finish with undertones of cocoa nib, cedar and honey.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a natural-processed version, meaning the beans were dried in the whole fruit. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Bright, richly sweet-tart. Bing cherry, pink grapefruit zest, magnolia, cocoa nib, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Juicy structure with high-toned acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The lingering finish fulfills the promise of the cup, complex and satiating.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the

Blind Assessment: Juicy-bright, sweetly tart. Red plum, tamarind, almond, tangerine zest, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Citrusy, high-toned acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Tangerine zest and agave syrup lead in the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced at Nyeri Hill Estate, from trees of the SL34, SL28 and Ruiru varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, citrusy. Cocoa nib, hop flowers, almond, magnolia, key lime in aroma and cup. Crisp, citric acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Magnolia and cocoa nib are front and center in the gentle finish.
Notes: Produced by Jancarlo and Sofia Handtke of Mapache Estate entirely of the big-beaned Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Chocolaty, quietly fruit-toned. Baking chocolate, goji berry, lemon verbena, nasturtium, fir in aroma and small cup. Creamy-rich mouthfeel; crisp, spice-toned, wood-framed finish. In three parts milk, balanced, sweetly chocolaty with undertones of goji berry and lemon verbena.
Notes: A blend of coffees from three origins: a washed Guatemala a washed Colombia, and a natural-processed Brazil, roasted for espresso applications. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet, tart, distinctly spice-toned. Guava, shishito peppers, basil, rhododendron, cedar in aroma and cup. Savory-leaning acidity; very smooth, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, spice-toned finish with floral undertones.
Notes: Produced by

Blind Assessment: Sweetly nut-toned, delicately bright. Pistachio, cocoa powder, red grape, cedar, hint of tarragon in aroma and cup. Brislky sweet acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of pistachio and red grape.
Notes: A blend of coffees from two origins: a washed Guatemala and a natural-processed Ethiopia. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply sweet, richly savory. Dark chocolate, salted almond nougat, tangerine zest, cedar, sorghum syrup in aroma and small cup. Crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel; chocolaty finish with cedar undertones. In cappuccino format,  tangerine zest notes are a good counterpoint to sweet dark chocolate.
Notes: An omni-blend (designed for espresso or brewed applications) comprised of coffees from Brazil, Guatemala and Ethiopia. Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Red currant, hop flowers, lychee, toffee, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of toffee and lychee, supported by cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Barichu Cooperative Society, from trees of the SL28, SL34, K7 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Drink Coffee Do Stuff operates a roastery in Truckee, California, and a coffee shop in nearby Incline Village, Nevada. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Rich-toned, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, pralines, black cherry, pink grapefruit, almond butter in aroma and small cup. Full, velvety mouthfeel; chocolaty, gently citrusy finish. In cappuccino format, both chocolaty and bright.
Notes: Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Coffee Name: Thailand Chaiprakarn Black Honey Single Origin Espresso
Coffee Origin: Chiang Mai growing region, northern Thailand
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Savory-sweet with a tart edge. Delicate chocolate
Notes: Produced from trees of the Chiang Mai, Typica and Catuaí varieties and processed by the black honey method (skins are removed, but coffee is dried enveloped in the fruit fleshor honey) by veteran coffee miller Noi Duongdee. Exported by Beanspire coffee. Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Wilder Lasso Geisha Lot 2 Anaerobic Washed
Blind Assessment: Elegantly fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Strawberry guava, lychee, cocoa nib, amber, ginger blossom in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet, gently tart, balanced acidity; vibrant, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Harmonious, resonant, coherent finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lasso, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by anaerobic fermentation in the whole fruit for 36 hours, followed by fermentation in mucilage for another 100 hours before being dried on raised beds. Exported by Desarrolladores de Cafe. Scott Rao and Mark Benedetto run Prodigal Coffee in Boulder, Colorado. Their goal is to share exceptional coffee that they are personally excited to drink every day. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly sweet, deep-toned. Date, pomegranate, chocolate fudge, gently scorched cedar, tangerine zest in aroma and small cup. Plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel; chocolaty, sweetly tart finish. In cappuccino format, pomegranate notes stand up to milk and chocolate lingers on and on.
Notes: In addition to his retail roasting operation, Aroma Roast Coffees, Simon Hsieh also operates Soaring Phoenix Trading, a business focused on purpose-built commercial espresso blends and high-quality single-origin coffees. Customers can also visit the new showroom, Chateau Andy, in Taipei City. Visit

Coffee Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidamo Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Balanced, juicy, bright. Dried cherry, sassafras, honey, almond, freesia in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Very long, deeply aromatic finish that carries over all the flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the 74112 and 74110 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kapi Dow is a small specialty coffee roaster in Taichung, Taiwan. Visit the

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply chocolate, delicately floral. Lilac, baking chocolate, hazelnut, orange zest, cedar in aroma and small cup. Lightly satiny mouthfeel; chocolaty finish with hints of orange zest. In cappuccino format, floral notes are amplified in harmony with baking chocolate.
Notes: A 50/50 blend of coffees from Guatemala and Colombia, both washed-process. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly tart, gently earthy. Blackberry, baking chocolate, lemon verbena, pipe tobacco, fresh-cut fir in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; earthy-sweet, citrusy-herbal finish. In three parts milk, notes of pipe tobacco and lemon verbena harmonize, supported by baking chocolate.
Notes: A 50/25/25 blend of a washed Colombia, a wet-hulled Sumatra, and a natural-processed Democratic Republic of the Congo. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply chocolaty. Dark chocolate, cashew, key lime, magnolia, cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty, sweetly nutty finish with undertones of magnolia, cedar and key lime.
Notes: Produced by the Asociación de Productores Cafetaleros de la Cuenca del Rio Marañón (APROCCURMA), from trees of the Bourbon, Catimor, Pache, Caturra and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart, spice-toned. Cinnamon candy, lime zest, baking chocolate, walnut, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish with walnut undertones.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia: a Mountain water-processed decaf Qonjo and a Wush Wush, both produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old Soul is a roastery, bakery, and crafter of artisanal goods dedicated to quality in every form. Visit

Coffee Origin: Riripa Village, West Arsi, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Impressively floral-toned, berry driven. Black raspberry, magnolia, marjoram, tangerine zest, amber in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning but balanced acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Exceptionally floral finish supported by berry and tangerine notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local varieties of Arabica (including 74110), and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Haro Adama
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Bright, juicy, balanced. Apricot, almond butter, star jasmine, bergamot, cedar in aroma and cup. Sparkling, vibrant acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish that extends the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Haro Washing Station. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply sweet, crisply chocolaty. Dark chocolate, date, almond, maple syrup, cedar in aroma and small cup. Crisp, satiny mouthfeel; chocolaty, nut-toned finish. In cappuccino format, rich-toned and deeply chocolaty.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Founded in 2009, Fresh Roasted Coffee’s values are quality, service, integrity, approachability and sustainability. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Washed Kaffa Lot Rich Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly chocolaty, deeply sweet-savory. Black cherry, hop flowers, magnolia, date, hint of teriyaki in aroma and small cup.  Creamy mouthfeel; floral finish with savory undertones. In cappuccino format, savory impulses are all but subsumed in sweet floral notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).  Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently aromatic, multi-layered. Candycap mushroom, rhododendron, lilac, cocoa nib, lychee in aroma and cup. Even-keeled, juicy acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Umami finish akin to candycap mushroom with  pleasing undertones of cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Karamo Niguse Gemeda 74158
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart, subtly nuanced. Cocoa nib, raspberry jam,  lemon balm, nougat, ginger blossom in aroma and cup. High-toned, balanced acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to cocoa-toned raspberry with hints of ginger blossom.
Notes: Produced by Nigusse Gemeda entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Rainy Season in Fort Zeelandia Espresso Blend
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Complex, multi-toned. Chocolate fudge, black cherry, almond blossom, sandalwood, pipe tobacco in aroma and small cup. Full, syrupy mouthfeel; very sweet, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, richly complex with wide-ranging floral and fruit notes, all supported by deep chocolate.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Honduras, Kenya and Guatemala, roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly savory-sweet. Candycap mushroom, roasted cashew, kiwi, amber, baking chocolate in aroma and small cup. Crisp, satiny mouthfeel; umami-driven finish with notes of candycap mushroom and amber. In cappuccino format, chocolate notes assume center stage, supported by kiwi and cashew.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers around the Murundo Washing Station, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying).
