Blind Assessment: Richly floral, brightly citrus-toned. Narcissus, bergamot, white tea, cocoa nib, oak in aroma and cup. Brightly juicy, bittersweet acidity; viscous, silky mouthfeel. Resonant, long finish that carries over all the aroma and flavor notes of the cup into the long.
Notes: Produced at Finca Tio Conejo, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deeply savory. Rambutan, pink peppercorn, candycap mushroom, dark chocolate, freesia in aroma and cup. Balanced, lively acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish leads with notes of freesia and dark chocolate with undertones of candycap mushroom.
Notes: Produced at Tio Conejo, entirely of the Tabi variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Complex, richly aromatic. Brandy barrel, dark chocolate, candied ginger, orange zest, hint of gardenia in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; plush, creamy mouth feel. Gently drying wood-framed finish with notes of brandy barrel and orange zest.
Notes: A blend of three Ethiopia coffees — a Guji Natural, a Sidamo Brandy Barrel-Aged, and a washed Bench-Maji. OLI Cafe Roaster is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung Dali, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Delicate, gently roast-toned. Passionfruit, scorched cedar, violet, dark chocolate, musk in aroma and small cup. Crisply satiny mouthfeel; long, richly chocolaty finish supported by notes of violet and pleasingly smoky dark chocolate. In three parts milk, quietly complex and rich-toned.
Notes: Comprised of three washed coffees: an Ethiopia Geisha, a Guatemala Caturra, and a Colombia Castillo. HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu growing region, Democratic Republic of Congo
Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly spice-toned. Ginger snaps, nectarine, cocoa nib, jasmine, cherry wood in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; smooth, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by notes of ginger snap.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Bourbon and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) at the Mukwinja Washing Station. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Cocoa nib, pink grapefruit, pomegranate, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish centers on notes of cocoa nib and pomegranate with undertones of pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “Let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply fruity, cocoa-toned. Baking chocolate, pink grapefruit, lychee, fresh-cut fir, almond in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Humberto Martinez of La Estrella Farm, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Slake Coffee is a small-batch roastery located on the Central Coast of California, that develops specific roast profiles for every coffee based on the inherent qualities of the bean. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, deep-toned. Baking chocolate, date, apple blossom, orange zest, Brazil nut in aroma and cup. Brisly sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and orange zest.
Notes: Certified USDA Organic and Fair Trade. Producer not disclosed. Twiga Coffee is based in Sacramento, California. Ten percent of all sales are donated to organizations supporting conservation efforts. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, citrusy. Wild honey, amber, Meyer lemon, lavender, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet acidity; plump, viscous mouthfeel. Long, lingering, resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by the Layo Teraga Coffee Producers Coop, entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Floral-toned, citrusy. Narcissus, tangerine, cocoa nib, pink peppercorn, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with sparkling acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Floral-toned cocoa notes anchor the resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by the Reko Farming Cooperative from selections of indigenous landrace tree varieties long grown in the Yirgacheffe region and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, nut-toned. Fig Newton, almond butter, marjoram, cedar, magnolia in aroma and cup. Very sweet structure with brisk acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply sweet, nut-driven finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Hunapu is Luis Pedro Zelaya’s project to create high-quality microlot coffees from smallholder producers within the Antigua region of Guatemala. Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, spice-toned. Baking spices (clove, cinnamon, nutmeg), cocoa powder, hazelnut, oak, molasses in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Especially long, harmonious, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Delmy Regalado of Finca La Fortuna, from trees of the Pacas and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, berry-toned. Black raspberry, baking chocolate, jasmine, cedar, orange zest in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of orange zest and cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Caturra, Colombia and Castillo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at El Puente processing facility. Drink Coffee Do Stuff operates a roastery in Truckee, California, and a coffee shop in nearby Incline Village, Nevada. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Huila El Diviso Nestor Lasso Geisha Washed
Blind Assessment: Bright, delicately juicy, richly aromatic. Cocoa nib, star jasmine, apricot, pink grapefruit, sage in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, long, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by brothers Nestor and Adrian Lasso of Finca El Diviso, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Origin: Bombe Village, Bensa District, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart, rich-toned. Blackberry, hazelnut, lavender, dark chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Delicately high-toned acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant finish centered around notes of lavender and dark chocolate.
Notes: Southern Ethiopia coffees like this one are largely produced from distinctive indigenous Ethiopia landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit the

Coffee Name: Colombia  Nariño Villa Maria La Chorrera Geisha Washed
Blind Assessment: Elegantly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, pear butter, cashew, cocoa nib, wisteria in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with vibrant acidity; very satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish has undertones of bergamot and wisteria.
Notes: Produced by Keny Adarme of Finca La Chorrera, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Name: Kenya Kirinyaga County Gikirima Factory TOP PB
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, juicy-bright. Dark chocolate, hop flowers, red currant, marjoram, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with bright, high-toned acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Very long finish that consolidates to notes of red currant and marjoram.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed at the Gikirima Factory by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Huila Finca Buena Vista Geisha Washed
Coffee Origin: El Jardin, Pitalito, Huila Department, Colombia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly citrusy, floral-toned. Pomelo, narcissus, almond butter, cedar,, wild honey in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet structure with brightly tart acidity; very syrupy, viscous mouthfeel. Citrusy, floral-driven finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca Buena Vista, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Special Winey
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, cocoa-toned. Dark chocolate, dried apricot, hazelnut, freesia-like flowers, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is crisply chocolaty with undertones of dried apricot and hazelnut.
Notes: Produced in the Bench-Maji Zone of southern Ethiopia, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia La Zulia Castillo Sweet Rose Honey
Blind Assessment: Delicate, deeply aromatic. Lychee, almond nougat, magnolia, frankincense, bergamot in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with balanced acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply sweet-tart finish with notes of almond nougat and bergamot.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Zulia, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. CoffeeBox Coffee founders Godfrey and Coco focus on small-batch coffee roasting with the goal of making the joy of premium coffee accessible to everyone. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Aromatically rich, sweetly tart. Red grape, pomegranate, dark chocolate, cedar, lemon verbena in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; fruit-toned, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, dark chocolate and pomegranate notes carry forward.
Notes: A blend of two Ethiopia coffees, one washed and one natural-processed, roasted for espresso applications. Cheer Beans is an importer of green coffee and a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung City, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe SOE Wote Konga Natural Espresso
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply fruit-driven. Kumquat, baking chocolate, cedar, marjoram, molasses in aroma and small cup. Lightly satiny mouthfeel; crisply chocolaty, herbaceous finish. In three parts milk, chocolate and kumquat notes predominate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Cheer Beans is an importer of green coffee and a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung City, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart, floral-toned. Magnolia, ume plum, candycap mushroom, amber, lemon balm in aroma and cup. High-toned, juicy acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. Exceptionally long, coherent finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic thermal shock method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly floral-toned, deeply aromatic. Star jasmine, wild raspberry, amber, dark chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor-laden finish carries over all the notes from the cup.
Notes: Guji is a coffee-growing region nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidamo regions. Guji coffees are largely produced from distinctive landrace varieties of Arabica long grown there. Processed by the natural method (beans are dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Elegant, lyrical, sweetly tart. Bergamot, dried cherry, cocoa nib, bay leaf, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Delicately sweet, balanced structure with high-toned acidity; very smooth, silky mouthfeel. Resonant, long, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Duwancho Cooperative, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly layered, deeply aromatic. Clove, narcissus, rum cordial, dried aprium, cocoa nib in aroma and small cup. Mouth-filling, weighty body; floral, cocoa-toned finish. In cappuccino format, very sweet, floral, spice-toned and chocolaty.
Notes: Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica TIM Washed Don Eli Catuai
Blind Assessment: Fruit-saturated. Mulberry, lime, lychee, black sage, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Richly sweet-tart acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply sweet-tart finish centered around notes of mulberry and salted caramel.
Notes: Produced by Carlos Montero, entirely of the Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) and fermented with coffee must. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Twakok Pearl Selection
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart, floral-toned. Dried apricot, narcissus, pistachio, tangerine, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-tart structure with gently bright acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Tart-leaning finish leads with notes of dried apricot and tangerine, with undertones of oak and pistachio.
Notes: Southern Ethiopia coffees like this one are largely produced from distinctive indigenous Ethiopian varieties of Arabica long grown in their respective regions. This is a natural-processed coffee (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Complex, deeply layered. Black cherry, dark chocolate, wisteria, pink peppercorn, caramelized walnut in aroma and small cup. Sweetly savory with juicy acidity; syrupy-smooth, vibrant mouthfeel. Resonant, long, flavor-saturated finish that leads with notes of black cherry and pink peppercorn.
Notes: Produced at Ukili Farm, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Natural Sin Limites SL28
Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, tropical. Baking chocolate, pineapple, ginger blossom, tarragon, cedar in aroma and cup. Intricately sweet with brisk acidity; satiny, viscous mouthfeel. Quiet finish consolidates to baking chocolate and ginger blossom.
Notes: Produced by the Montero Family, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly chocolaty, fruity. Blackberry jam, dark chocolate, cedar, tangerine, almond butter in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; harmonious, integrated, flavor-laden finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, dark chocolate and blackberry notes take center stage, complicated by sweet citrus and rich nut tones.
Notes: A blend of washed and natural-processed coffees of undisclosed origin, tested as espresso. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Name: Kenya Lemon and Citrus Symphony Super C
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, brightly sweet-savory. Raspberry, lemon balm, cocoa nib, oak, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and lemon balm.
Notes: Purchased from C. Dorman, Ltd; comprised of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, crisply sweet-tart. Baking chocolate, red plum, almond, Meyer lemon zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Invitingly bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of apricot and almond.
Notes: Produced by Alba Flores, entirely of the Typica Pluma variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Name: Panama Baru Geisha Moonlight Black Solar ASD
Blind Assessment: Fruit-toned, cocoa-driven. Lychee, cocoa powder, gardenia, fir, cashew in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Sweetly wood-framed finish with undertones of cocoa powder.
Notes: Produced from trees of the celebrated Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Geisha (also spelled Gesha). “Black” refers to a proprietary method of drying and fruit removal developed by innovative boutique exporter/importer Ninety Plus Coffee. Lee Dong Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taichung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, hazelnut, fir, orange zest, marjoram in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Orange zest and baking chocolate lead in the long finish.
Notes: Produced by Ricardo Palma, from trees of the Pache, Typica, Caturra, Catimor, and Yellow and Red Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Brunca Rivense La Guaca Passion Honey
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, cocoa-toned. Cocoa powder, orange zest, almond, freesia, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The quiet finish leads with cocoa and almond notes.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Rivense, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (coffee fruit is pulped or skinned but dried in the fruit flesh). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Aris Red Honey Lot
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, delicately fruit-toned. Persimmon, Brazil nut, tiger lily, cedar, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The wood-framed finish is crisply sweet, gently drying.
Notes: Processed by the red honey method, meaning that some fruit flesh or “honey” was allowed to adhere to the beans during drying. Lee Dong Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taichung, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Brewed in a Toddy Small-Batch Artisan Brewer and evaluated chilled. Balanced, crisply sweet-tart. Raspberry, almond blossom, toffee, cedar, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Viscous, satiny mouthfeel; berry- and nut-driven finish. With milk, like a creamy raspberry dessert.
Notes: A whole-bean coffee sourced and roasted for cold brewing at home. For this review, brewed at the

Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, lilac, black cherry, fresh-cut oak, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Balanced structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to cocoa nib and brown sugar with lilac undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from the Tangara community, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, citrusy. Grapefruit zest, golden raisin, hazelnut, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, vibrant acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisp finish consolidates to notes of lemon verbena and cedar.
Notes: A blend of undisclosed washed and natural-processed coffees. Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Elegant, uniquely pungent, deeply floral. Prickly pear fruit, wild honey, tea rose, vanilla, almond, tangerine zest. Sweet, floral-toned acidity; delicate, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant rich finish consolidates to notes of tea rose and tangerine zest.
Notes: A blend of two coffees — a Colombia Quindio Mangosteen Honey Castillo and a washed Ethiopia Guji Shakiso.

Coffee Name: Kanazawa Light Roasted Espresso House Blend
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Bright, citrusy, high-toned. Green apple, salted caramel, orange zest, oak, freesia in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; tart-leaning finish. In three parts milk, tart fruit notes mingle below a salted caramel throughline.
Notes: A blend of undisclosed green coffees roasted for espresso applications. Cafe Fugu is a nano-roaster and coffee shop based in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Lucy Station Geisha Washed
Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, balanced. Pomegranate, lily, cashew butter, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centered around notes of cashew and cedar.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Cafe Fugu is a nano-roaster and coffee shop based in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Huila Finca Rodrigo Sanchez Purple Caturra Natural
Blind Assessment: Quietly balanced, sweet-toned. Green apple, pistachio, cocoa powder, fir, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety-smooth mouthfeel. The gently drying finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned fir and pistachio.
Notes: Produced by Rodrigo Sanchez Valencia of Finca Monteblanco, entirely of the Purple Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Cafe Fugu is a nano-roaster and coffee shop based in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, sweetly savory. Cocoa nib, bay leaf, goji berry, caramel, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish centered around cocoa nib and pink peppercorn notes.
Notes: Produced by members of the Kibugu Farmer's Cooperative Society, from trees of the SL 28, Ruiru 11 and Batian varieties of Arabica. Coffee Cycle Roasting is a San Diego-based specialty roaster founded by cycling enthusiasts. Visit

Coffee Origin: Wenago district, Gedeo Zone, SNNPR, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply fruit-toned. Dried mulberry, gardenia, cashew, orange zest, oak in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Orange zest and almond notes carry the finish.
Notes: Produced by Wolde Hirbe, from heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at the Adame Gorbota Cooperative. Coffee Cycle Roasting is a San Diego-based specialty roaster founded by cycling enthusiasts. Visit

Blind Assessment: Nuanced, richly fruit-forward. Raspberry, dark chocolate, honey, narcissus, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, very syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering finish resonant with notes of honey and narcissus, with raspberry and dark chocolate undertones.
Notes: Produced by Jaime Lopez of Finca La Fortuna, from trees of the Castillo and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Nostalgia Coffee Roasters was founded by Taylor Fields in 2018 as a mobile café; it has since added specialty roasting, an online store, a café, and a national wholesale program featuring select fine coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, deeply spice-toned. Cinnamon, clove, dark chocolate, pie cherry, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of dark and clove with undertones of sandalwood.
Notes: Produced by Luis Eduardo Campos, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Complex, floral-toned. Lavender, pear, kumquat, marjoram, pistachio in aroma and small cup. Silky, viscous mouthfeel; sweetly herbaceous, citrusy finish. In three parts milk, rich, nutty, floral.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia and Guatemala, roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, floral-toned. Nutella, magnolia, orange zest, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty, nutty finish with floral undertones.
Notes: Produced by Rene Contreras on the family farm in Monte Verde and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Speedwell Coffee, based in Plymouth, Massachusetts, is a wholesale and retail specialty roaster particularly dedicated to offering attractive coffee subscription plans. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart. Blackberry compote, cocoa nib, toffee, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Especially lively, juicy-bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Toffee and blackberry notes center the long finish.
Notes: Produced at Nyeri Hill Estate, from trees of the SL28, SL34 and Riuru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly chocolaty. Dark chocolate, date, narcissus, almond, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet, balanced acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Sweet-toned finish with notes of dark chocolate and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Santuario Cooperative, from trees of the Caturra, Bourbon, Pache, Catimor and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit

Coffee Name: Papua New Guinea Jiwaka Arufa Natural
Blind Assessment: Sweetly fruit-driven. Dried cranberry, freesia, bay leaf, almond, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; full, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. The quiet finish is framed by notes of dried cranberry and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at the Kindeng Wet Mill. True Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe in Wisconsin whose motto is, “On a never-ending quest to bring you a great cup of coffee, by staying true to the bean.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tart, berry-toned. Mulberry, cocoa nib, Meyer lemon zest, agave syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Mulberry and cocoa nib are central in the balanced finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers near the Koke Washing Station, operated by Semira Negash, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (some fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, richly nut-toned. Baking chocolate, hazelnut brittle. red grape, cedar, amber in aroma and cup. Sweetly brisk acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Nut-toned, chocolaty finish.
Notes: Produced by The Pillimue Group, from trees of the Caturra and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Utopian Coffee is a specialty roaster based in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, high-toned, juicy-bright. Nectarine, dark chocolate, brown sugar, almond butter, key lime in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The fruit-driven finish has undertones of key lime and brown sugar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Lin Jen-Wei’s Black Jar Coffee, a Taiwan-based nano-roaster and café, is named for both the Taiwanese slang phrase “black soy sauce in black jar,” indicating something is difficult to see through, and the literal black jar in which this company stores coffee to protect it from UV light. Roasted by Lin Jen-Wei, the daughter of the owner, who has been roasting for five years (since she was 13!). For more information, visit the

Coffee Origin: Los Robles de Naranjo, West Valley, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Gently fruity, richly nut-toned. Hazelnut butter, mulberry, cocoa nib, oak, magnolia in aroma and cup. Sweet, gentle acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with mulberry undertones.
Notes: Produced by Felipe and Erasmo Aguilera, entirely of the Villa Sarchi variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, candied orange zest, almond, date, cedar in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Balanced, crisply sweet finish centered around notes of baking chocolate and almond.
Notes: A blend of washed coffees, one from Colombia and one from Guatemala. Intuition Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Peoria, Illinois. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Flor Lichi Meet Patch
Blind Assessment: Fruit-toned, sweetly tart. Dried, persimmon, baking chocolate, nutmeg, tangerine, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Juicy, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of baking chocolate and tangerine.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Loma, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented in an oxygen-free environment, then dried in the whole fruit). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan.

Blind Assessment: Sweetly wood-framed, berry-driven. Raspberry, fresh-cut fir, maple syrup, lily, lime zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with raspberry and lime undertones.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a natural-processed Ethiopia, a washed Colombia, and an enzyme-washed Costa Rica. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan.

Blind Assessment: Complex, fruit-driven, deep-toned. Candied kumquat, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, ume plum, caramel in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart acidity; very syrupy mouthfeel. Tartly fruity finish with undertones of crisp cocoa nib and lemon verbena.
Notes: A blend of both washed and natural processed coffees from Costa Rica and Ethiopia. Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Coffee Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Elegantly floral, richly fruity. Star jasmine, passionfruit, ginger, cocoa nib, myrrh in aroma and cup. High-toned, sparkling acidity; delicately silky-smooth mouthfeel. Long, lingering, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Kraig Lee of Kona Farm Direct, entirely of the Mokka variety of Arabica (from trees planted with Mokka seeds from Hula Daddy Farm), and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned; richly aromatic. Red currant, cocoa nib, maple syrup, lemongrass, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish supported by red currant and lemongrass notes.
Notes: Produced at the Getuya factory, from trees of the SL28, SL34, Batian and Ruiru 11  varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Beanberry Coffee has a roastery in Woking, Surrey, and two cafes, one in London and one in Kingston upon Thames. Visit

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, crisply floral-toned. Baking chocolate, lily, red plum, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Sweet, chocolaty finish with undertones of hazelnut and cedar.
Notes: Produced by Olga Calle, from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Beanberry Coffee has a roastery in Woking, Surrey, and two cafes, one in London and one in Kingston upon Thames. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently fruit-toned, delicately floral. Apricot, cocoa nib, freesia, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Cocoa-driven finish with undertones of apricot.
Notes: A blend of two coffees, one Ethiopia and one Rwanda, both washed. Nodi, which means “knots” in Latin, is a roastery and coffee shop with locations in Hong Kon and Shanghai. Visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, gently herbaceous. Cocoa powder, date, walnut, lemon verbena, fresh-cut fir. Sweetly brisk acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, bittersweet, wood-framed finish.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a natural-processed Brazil, a washed Colombia and a wet-hulled Sumatra. Nodi, which means “knots” in Latin, is a roastery and coffee shop with locations in Hong Kon and Shanghai. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy-bright, balanced. Raspberry, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, almond butter, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. High-toned, sweetly tart acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Lemon verbena and cocoa nib predominate in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Symon Mariku of Njawato Estate, from trees of the SL28 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Succulent Coffee Roasters is a Southern California specialty roaster and coffee shop founded in 2019. Visit

Blind Assessment: Tart-leaning, crisply fruity. Pomegranate, dark chocolate, magnolia, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Resonant, chocolaty and fruit-forward finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Guardia, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Achilles Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based specialty roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet, crisply tart. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, red apple, maple syrup, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very syrupy, vibrant mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of Cooperlibertad, from trees of the Catuai and Obata varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Satur Specialty Coffee is a farm-to-cup roastery, coffee shop, and SCA training center. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, nut-toned. Hazelnut, caramel, orange zest, freesia, fir in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of hazelnut and orange zest.
Notes: Produced at Finca Medina and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Satur Specialty Coffee is a farm-to-cup roastery, coffee shop, and SCA training center. Visit

Coffee Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Citrusy, richly spice-toned. Bergamot, lemongrass, nutmeg, almond, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart, high-toned acidity; lush, silky mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of bergamot and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Hutu Cafe Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan.

Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, sweetly savory. Blackberry, vanilla yogurt, dried hibiscus flowers, cashew, cedar in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Gentle finish centered around notes of vanilla yogurt and dried hibiscus.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia (aneorobic washed), Kenya (washed) and Ethiopia (honey). Hutu Cafe Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan.

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, invitingly tart. Lilac, dark chocolate, blackberry, pink grapefruit zest, musk in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The flavor-laden finish leads with blackberry in the short, rounding to deep chocolate and musk notes in the long.
Notes: A blend comprised of five coffees: a natural-processed Panama Geisha; a double-anaerobic washed Colombia Geisha; a double-anaerobic washed Colombia Castillo; a washed Ethiopia; and a natural-processed Ethiopia. Tumaz Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei City, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Quindio Campo Hermoso Wush Wush
Blind Assessment: Richly chocolaty, fruit-driven. Raspberry jam, baking chocolate, agave syrup, cedar, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Crisply sweet-tart finish centered around berry and chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso, entirely of the Wush Wus variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying. Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly whiskey-toned. Bourbon barrel, milk chocolate, vanilla, hazelnut, orange zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply sweet finish with notes of bourbon barrel and milk chocolate.
Notes: Produced at Mukarimu Estate, from trees of the SL28, SL34, Batian and Ruiru11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). The green coffee was then rested in bourbon barrels. Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit

Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, passionfruit, wisteria, musk, tangerine in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Delicate finish centers around notes of wisteria and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed at the Benti Nenka Washing Station by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Sonora San Isidro 48
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, fruit-forward. Strawberry, cocoa nib, lime zest, thyme, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Quiet finish with notes of cocoa nib and cedar with undertones of strawberry and lime zest.
Notes: Produced by Albert and Diego Guardia, entirely of the local San Isidro 48 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Huila El Triunfo Pink Bourbon Anaerobic Washed
Blind Assessment: Juicy, fruit-toned. Dried plum, lychee, cocoa nib, narcissus, bergamot in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, vibrant acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Complex, long floral- and fruit-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Martha Zuniga of Finca El Triunfo, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method (in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Assefa 74112 SLD Black Honey
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet, delicately fruity. Date, hazelnut, lily, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The wood-framed finish is briskly sweet into the long.
Notes: Southern Ethiopia coffees like this one are largely produced from distinctive indigenous Ethiopian landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in their respective regions. Processed by the black honey method, in which much of the fruit flesh is left on the bean during the dying process. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Hamasho Slow Dry Natural
Blind Assessment: Crisp, sweetly nut-driven. Hazelnut, agave syrup, red apple, balsa wood, lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of hazelnut and agave syrup, with undertones of balsa wood.
Notes: Produced by Bekele Kachara, entirely of the 74158 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, crisply sweet-tart. Baking chocolate, apricot, almond, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of apricot and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Jackrabbit Java selects the finest coffees from around the world and roasts them in Thermopolis, Wyoming’s mountain air. All Jackrabbit Java coffees are specialty-grade and roasted to order. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deeply chocolaty, rich-toned. Dark chocolate, hazelnut butter, magnolia, pear, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly nutty finish.
Notes: Produced by the Guirola Family of Finca Montevideo, from trees of the Bourbon and  processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by Jackrabbit Java selects the finest coffees from around the world and roasts them in Thermopolis, Wyoming’s mountain air. All Jackrabbit Java coffees are specialty-grade and roasted to order. Visit

Coffee Name: Papua New Guinea Korgua Estate A
Coffee Origin: Waghi Valley, Western Highlands, Papua New Guinea
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, crisply sweet. Date, caramel, orange zest, freesia, oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Quietly inviting finish leads with notes of caramel and orange zest.
Notes: Produced by the Leahy family of Korgua Estate and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Produced Jackrabbit Java selects the finest coffees from around the world and roasts them in Thermopolis, Wyoming’s mountain air. All Jackrabbit Java coffees are specialty-grade and roasted to order. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Gesha Anaerobic Natural
Blind Assessment: Richly fruit-forward, intensely aromatic. Concord grape, tiramisu, agave syrup, lilac, amber in aroma and cup. Juicy, bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The bold finish centers around notes of Concord grape and amber.
Notes: Produced by Alejo Khale Castro of Volcán Azul Farm, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit). Bird Rock Coffee Roasters is a retailer and wholesaler focused on organic and socially responsible coffees; it was named the “2012 Micro Roaster of the Year” by

Blind Assessment: Refreshingly bright, citrusy-sweet. Tangerine, lychee, ginger blossom, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned, citrusy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of tangerine and cedar with hints of ginger blossom.
Notes: Produced by Rodrigo Sanchez Valencia of Finca Monteblanco, entirely of the Purple Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method with the addition of coconut and citrus fruit to the conventional fermentation step. SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly fruit- and floral-toned. Narcissus, date, almond, candycap mushroom, honey in aroma and cup. Savory-sweet structure; smooth, honey-like body. Narcissus and candycap mushroom notes preside in the long finish.
Notes: Produced by Arsenio Muñoz of Finca Los Cauchos, entirely of the Chiroso variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit).SÖT Coffee Roaster, based in Osaka, Japan, is a self-described Swedish-style roaster with an “aggressively light” roasting style. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deep-toned, richly sweet-savory. Dark chocolate, dried raspberry, salted caramel, gently scorched oak, hint of sage in aroma and small cup. Plush, syrupy mouthfeel; crisply sweet-tart finish. In three parts milk, chocolate and raspberry notes harmonize with a salted caramel throughline.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia, Costa Rica, Kenya and Ethiopia, roasted for espresso applications. In addition to his retail roasting operation, Aroma Roast Coffees, Simon Hsieh also operates Soaring Phoenix Trading, a business focused on purpose-built commercial espresso blends and high-quality single-origin coffees. Customers can also visit the new showroom, Chateau Andy, in Taipei City. Visit

Blind Assessment: Vibrant, elegant, richly sweet, complex. Peach, aromatic orchid, Meyer lemon zest, cocoa nib, rosewood in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; silky, lively mouthfeel. Long, enticing, coherent finish that fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 3 coffee on

Coffee Name: El Salvador Finca Loma La Gloria Yellow Honey
Coffee Origin: El Bálsamo Quetzaltepec growing region, El Salvador
Blind Assessment: Crisp, richly sweet-tart. Dark chocolate, dried nectarine, narcissus, almond brittle, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of chocolaty nectarine.
Notes: Produced by Anny Ruth Pimentel of Finca Loma La Gloria, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the Yellow Honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the fruit during the drying process. Old Soul is a roastery, bakery and crafter of artisanal goods dedicated to quality in every form. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica La Laguna Lot — Reserve Series
Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, fruity and bright. Bing cherry, dark chocolate, snickerdoodle, pistachio, sweet lime in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; plush, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The crisply fruit-toned finish is supported by pistachio and dark chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced by the Mora family on their family farm, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Old Soul is a roastery, bakery and crafter of artisanal goods dedicated to quality in every form. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, crisply sweet. Pomegranate, cocoa nib, goji berry, cedar, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Balanced, red apple-like acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Especially flavor-saturated finish, resonant and long.
Notes: Produced by Bekele Kachara, from trees of the 74158 and 74112 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old Soul is a roastery, bakery and crafter of artisanal goods dedicated to quality in every form. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply chocolaty, richly floral, sweetly tart. Chocolate fudge, wisteria, black cherry, toffee, cedar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; long, flavor-laden finish. In cappuccino format, complex, nuanced and satiating.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 14 coffee on

Coffee Name: Colombia El Paraiso Geisha Luna Washed
Blind Assessment: Richly aromatic, chocolaty and fruit-forward. Dark chocolate, bergamot, lychee, musk, tarragon in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Intense, quite long finish with leading notes of dark chocolate and tarragon.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 25 coffee on

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Gesha Anaerobic Natural
Blind Assessment: Sweetly fermenty, elegantly berry-toned. Mulberry, red wine, cocoa nib, vanilla bean, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; plush, silky-smooth mouthfeel. Quite long, coherent, complex finish.
Notes: Produced by Alejo Khale Castro of Volcán Azul Farm, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit). Roasted at PT’s Coffee, where the motto is “Without the love, it’s just coffee.” Visit

Blind Assessment: Fruit-forward, rich-toned. Blackberry jam, dark chocolate, narcissus, lemon balm, honey in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, vibrant acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The berry-driven finish has undertones of dark chocolate and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding the Abore Washing Station, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Magnolia Coffee is a Charlotte, North Carolina-based specialty roaster whose mission is to use sustainably sourced coffees to make a difference in the lives of coffee workers and to foster a socially conscious community with cause-supporting coffees. Visit

Coffee Name: Costa Rica Diego Abarca Gesha Natural
Blind Assessment: Delicately tart, crisply sweet. Goji berry, pie cherry, lily, fir, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Tart fruit and salted caramel notes carry the inviting finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Abarca of Finca San Calletano, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Duluth Coffee is a cafe and wholesale specialty roaster founded in 2012 in downtown Duluth, Minnesota by Eric Faust. Visit

Coffee Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Lively, aromatically resonant, deeply complex. Cocoa nib, vanilla orchid, tamarind, pistachio, amber in aroma and cup. Rich structure with sweet-tart-savory acidity; lyrically full, viscous body. Harmonious, integrated finish that leads with notes of vanilla orchid, pistachio and cocoa nib.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 2 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Complex, spice-toned, floral. Ginger blossom, candied violet, clove, pomegranate, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Balanced, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, richly aromatic finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 11 coffee on

Coffee Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply layered, juicy-bright. Black cherry, magnolia, cocoa nib, marjoram, cedar in aroma and cup. Richly sweet-tart structure with high-toned acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonantly sweet finish with tart fruit up front and sweet florals underneath.
Notes: Made entirely from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica and grown on Hula Daddy’s higher elevation farm; processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh removed before drying). This presentation of the coffee is named for co-owner Karen Paterson, whose middle name is Jue and whose favorite coffee is the Red Bourbon. Hula Daddy is a boutique coffee producer with farms at the 1,400 and 2,500-foot levels of the Mount Hualalai volcano near the northern end of the Kona growing district, five minutes above the town of Kailua-Kona. Visit

Blind Assessment: Elegantly floral, vibrantly fruit-forward. Wisteria, bergamot, frankincense, mangosteen, black cherry in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 4 coffee on

Blind Assessment: Chocolaty and very floral. Dark chocolate fudge, vanilla orchid, pink peppercorn, calamansi, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Balanced, high-toned acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Long, inviting, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: This exceptional coffee was selected as the No. 22 coffee on

Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisply floral-toned, very lively. Star jasmine, wild raspberry, honey, dark chocolate, hint of shishito pepper in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with delicate, juicy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The flavor-saturated finish fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a natural-processed version, meaning the beans were dried in the whole fruit. Certified USDA organic. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, rich-toned, complex. Apricot, tamarind, pink grapefruit zest, dark chocolate, candied violet in aroma and cup. Savory-sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, satiating finish with resonant stone fruit, citrus zest and dark chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gikanda Cooperative, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet, balanced. Wild honey, bergamot, sassafras, cocoa nib, freesia in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Sweet-toned finish centered around notes of cocoa nib and bergamot.
Notes: Produced at Silver Cloud Farm, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary method involving the addition of wine yeasts to the fermentation. Big Island Coffee is an award-winning coffee roaster operated with hands-on passion by Kelleigh Stewart and Brandon von Damitz. Visit

Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet. Cocoa nib, pear, narcissus, almond, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; crisp, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and pear.
Notes: Produced by Rosendo Domingo of Palanch’en Farm, from trees of the Caturra and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). The company name Amavida combines the Spanish words for love and life, reflecting Amavida’s multifaceted commitment to fairness and fine coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly fruit-toned, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine zest, cocoa nib, bay leaf, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of lychee and tangerine zest with sweet herb undertones.
Notes: Produced by Peter Mbature of Kamavindi Estate, from trees of the SL28 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Wonderstate Coffee, formerly Kickapoo Coffee, is an award-winning roaster based in rural Wisconsin known for its commitment to guaranteeing higher pay for farmers and operating the country’s first 100% solar-powered roastery. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicate, very nuanced. Lilac, bergamot, cocoa nib, cedar, wild honey in aroma and cup. Richly sweet structure with bright, balanced acidity; plush, silky mouthfeel. Long, rich, floral-toned finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Zulia, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Wishingvine is a Taichung, Taiwan specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned. Dried cranberry, freesia, fennel, hazelnut, lemon balm in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp finish leads with notes of cranberry and hazelnut.
Notes: Produced by Fredy Orantes, entirely of the Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). The company name Amavida combines the Spanish words for love and life, reflecting Amavida’s multifaceted commitment to fairness and fine coffee. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, chocolaty. Pomegranate, toffee, baking chocolate, graham cracker, cedar in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and pomegranate with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the CESMACH Cooperative from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Mundo Novo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, fruit-toned. Dried plum, cocoa nib, cedar, lemon verbena, freesia in aroma and cup. Delicately tart structure with brisk acidity; viscous satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa and cedar notes frame the sweet-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Rodrigo Sanchez of Finca Monteblanco, entirely of the Purple Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Wishingvine is a Taichung, Taiwan specialty coffee roaster. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweet-toned, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, caramel, date, almond, fir in aroma and small cup. Satiny mouthfeel; chocolaty, nut-toned finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, chocolate and nut tones preside.
Notes: A blend of three coffees — a washed Kenya, a natural-processed Ethiopia and a natural-processed Brazil — roasted for espresso applications. Moye Forest is a specialty coffee roaster in Taoyuan, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Santa Monica Castillo Honey Lulo
Blind Assessment: Tangy sweet, delicately fruit-toned. Dried hibiscus flower, pistachio, cannabis, fresh perique-fermented tobacco, cotton candy in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; plush but buoyant mouthfeel. Crisp, complex, bittersweet finish.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila of Finca Santa Monica, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica. Subject in the whole fruit to anaerobic fermentation for 72 hours, with lulo fruit and wine yeasts added to the fermentation, then dried on raised beds.  Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit

Blind Assessment: Juicy-bright, very sweet, with a tart edge. Honeysuckle, strawberry, pipe tobacco, cane sugar, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Sweetly juicy acidity; buoyant, lightly syrupy in the mouthfeel. Consolidates to florals and pipe tobacco in the long finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso processed by a two-stage carbonic maceration method which involves fermenting the coffee, first as whole fruit, then after pulping, inside a sealed CO2-flushed tank, with strawberry and coffee must added to the tank.  RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Crisply savory, very sweet. Hazelnut, rhododendron, fig, dried raspberry, salted caramel in aroma and cup. In taste structure displays a startling but pleasing juxtaposition of intense sweetness and deep umami. Lightly satiny in mouthfeel. Smooth, resonant in the finish – fig, vanilla.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic honey method with the addition of red fruits to the fermentation step. Prism Coffee Works is a specialty roaster, cafe and barista training center based in Seoul, South Korea. Visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Castillo Special Fermentation Washed Fruit of Taiwan
Blind Assessment: High-toned, tangy. Cocoa powder, peach kefir, jasmine, lychee, almond. Tartly sweet, roundly savory; full, plush mouthfeel. Rich-toned finish centered around notes of cocoa powder and peach kefir.
Notes: Part of the Winemaker Green Coffee Series jointly developed by Bean Super and local wineries in Taiwan, this Colombia Castillo is anaerobically fermented with the addition of Taiwanese fruits, including grape pulp, to the fermentation. Riika Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster based in New Taipei City, Taiwan. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Deep, rich, sweetly herbaceous. Heavy cream, sweet herb melange, caramel, Meyer lemon, the aroma of oak forest in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plump mouthfeel. Fades gracefully to bittersweet herb notes.
Notes: Produced by John Vergara of Finca Las Flores, entirely of the Yellow Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed anaerobic process with the addition of mint leaves to the fermentation step. Founded in 1995 by Brooke McDonnell and Helen Russell, Equator Coffees operates retail stores in the San Francisco Bay Area and Southern California and provides coffee to hundreds of wholesale accounts. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly tangy, deeply floral. Lily, lemon verbena, peach skin, fir, vanilla yogurt in aroma and cup. Lactic-fruity structure; nectar-like mouthfeel. In the long, balanced finish, raspberry notes emerge.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Victoria, entirely of the Anacafe 14 variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit) with the addition of Jocote fruit to the fermentation. Euphora Coffee is a Taipei-based specialty coffee roaster with an active online community through which all sales are made. Visit

Blind Assessment: Fruity, tangy, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, pineapple kefir, lychee, fresh-cut fir, almond in aroma and cup. Balanced, round acidity; crisp, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and lychee in a rich, smooth finish.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Loma, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit) with the addition of peach juice to the fermentation. David's Nose is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan whose founder studied agronomy and has a deep interest in crop quality. For more information, visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Finca Monteblanco Purple Caturra Passionfruit Washed
Blind Assessment: Delicately fruit-forward, deep-toned. Pomegranate, alyssum, saltwater taffy, almond, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Gentle finish centered around suggestions of pomegranate and almond.
Notes: Produced at Finca Monteblanco, entirely of the Purple Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying) with the addition of passionfruit to the conventional fermentation step. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: Santa Maria de Dota, Tarrazu, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Low-toned, richly tangy and chocolaty. Dark chocolate, goji berry, cedar, lemon yogurt, cilantro in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure; lean, smooth mouthfeel. Quite rich, resonant and layered in the short finish, concluding with cedar notes in the long.
Notes: Produced by Ivan Solis and processed by the anaerobic natural method (fermented and dried in the whole fruit) with the addition of coffee must to the fermentation. B&W Coffee Roasters is a North Carolina-based roastery and cafe specializing in small-lot direct-trade coffees. For more information, visit

Coffee Name: Colombia Las Flores Red Bourbon Natural
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart. Tamarind, raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy-tart acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of raspberry and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by the Ayure Family of Finca Las Flores, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit

Coffee Origin: Werka, Refisa Kebele, Nensebo District, West Arsi, Oromia, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Chocolaty, delicately fruit-toned. Baking chocolate, strawberry, lime zest, oak, narcissus in aroma and cup. Sweet, gentle acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Baking chocolate and strawberry are front and center in the inviting finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding the Nensebo Washing Station, from local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Complex, richly sweet-savory. Apricot, green tomato, toffee, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and small cup. Vibrant, syrupy mouthfeel; sweet finish centered around toffee and apricot notes. In cappuccino format, toffee-driven with undercurrents of apricot and hazelnut.
Notes: A blend of four coffees: a washed Kenya, a washed Ethiopia, a natural-processed Ethiopia, and a washed Guatemala. Night & Bean Coffee is a specialty roaster and coffee shop in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Balanced, juicy, deep-toned. Black cherry, blueberry, dark chocolate, cedar, cashew in aroma and small cup. Viscous, satiny mouthfeel; crisply tart, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, dark chocolate blooms and is supported by blueberry undertones.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a washed and a natural-processed Ethiopia and a washed Guatemala. Night & Bean Coffee is a specialty roaster and coffee shop in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Visit

Coffee Name: Ethiopia Oromia Djimma Limu Gummay Natural
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Juicy-sweet, vibrant. Red plum, mango, almond, tangerine, cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned structure with bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of mango and almond with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of local heirloom varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Cozy House Coffee is a Taiwan-based specialty coffee roaster and an SCA Authorized Trainer (AST). For more information, visit the

Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned, crisply bright. Almond brittle, cocoa nib, pomegranate, cedar, orange zest in aroma and small cup. Syrupy-smooth mouthfeel; nutty, crisply cocoa-toned finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, almond and pomegranate notes commingle.
Notes: A blend of three coffees: a washed Ethiopia, a washed Colombia and a natural-processed Brazil. Night & Bean Coffee is a specialty roaster and coffee shop in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Visit

Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Tomato leaf, red currant, candied violet, cedar, almond butter in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Resonant, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Kiri Cooperative, from trees of the Batian, SL28, SL34 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit

Coffee Name: El Salvador Finca San Antonio Gesha Natural
Blind Assessment: Intricately fruity, gently floral. Tangerine, lychee, magnolia, dark chocolate, myrrh in aroma and cup. High-toned, sweetly tart acidity; vibrant, viscous, silky mouthfeel. Citrusy and chocolaty finish with undertones of myrrh.
Notes: Produced by Jhony Lemus of Finca San Antonio, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet, richly spice-toned. Apricot, clove, magnolia, hazelnut, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Apricot and hazelnut lead in the crisp, clean finish.
Notes: Produced by the Ureñas Family of Finca El Desafio, from trees of the Villa Sarchi variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process. Joe Bean Roasters is a specialty retail and wholesale coffee roaster based in Rochester, New York. Visit

Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Baking chocolate, salted caramel, dried persimmon, pink grapefruit zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with gentle acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of salted caramel and pink grapefruit zest.
Notes: Produced by Don Francisco and Blanca Nieve of Finca El Diamante, from trees of the Caturra, Bourbon, Pache and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Joe Bean Roasters is a specialty retail and wholesale coffee roaster based in Rochester, New York. Visit

Coffee Name: Nicaragua Don Roger Fruit Symphony Natural & Maceration
Blind Assessment: High-toned, richly sweet-tart-savory. Raspberry jam, dark chocolate, pie cherry, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with tart-savory acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Deeply chocolaty and fruit-toned in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Don Roger and Isabel Mairena of Gold Mountain Coffee Farms from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra, Java and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the carbonic maceration method, which involves fermenting whole coffee fruit inside a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2, then drying the coffee in the whole fruit. Joe Bean Roasters is a specialty retail and wholesale coffee roaster based in Rochester, New York. Visit

Blind Assessment: Fruit-forward, chocolaty. Blueberry, baking chocolate, lemon verbena, fresh-cut oak, amber in aroma and cup. Winey acidity; full, satiny-smooth body. The resonant finish leads with notes of blueberry and baking chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Ignacio Gutierrez of Finca Los Positos, entirely of the Pacas variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit

Blind Assessment: Delicate, sweetly fruit-toned. Red grape, cashew butter, ginger blossom, fresh-cut fir, caramel in aroma and small cup. Gentle, round acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. The quiet, fruity finish is supported by notes of caramel and fir.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Costa Rica, Guatemala and Ethiopia. Caffè Luxxe is an Italian-inflected artisan roaster and retailer that emphasizes both its coffee knowledge and precision and its straightforward lack of pretension. Visit

Blind Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned. Dried cranberry, narcissus, fennel, hazelnut, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; silly-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp drying finish leads with notes of cranberry and hazelnut.
Notes: Produced by the Melendez Family of Finca Monte de Oro, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Joe Bean Roasters is a specialty retail and wholesale coffee roaster based in Rochester, New York. Visit

Coffee Origin: Ethiopia; Brazil; Mexico; Papua New Guinea
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Dark chocolate, caramel, macadamia nut, cedar, marjoram in aroma and small cup. Crisply velvety mouthfeel; gently drying, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, dark chocolate notes are front and center, with macadamia nut and cedar undertones.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Brazil, Mexico and Papua New Guinea, roasted for espresso applications. Caffè Luxxe is an Italian-inflected artisan roaster and retailer that emphasizes both its coffee knowledge and precision and its straightforward lack of pretension. Visit
